--- 帖子 #870 ---
hi .. thnaks for creating this great EA. i have been using EA for 10 overyears and still found Grid EA is the best for consistance prifit.

however. can your EA add money managment option? instead of opening a fix lot size, and change to open lot size base on account balance ?

thank you

--- 帖子 #871 ---
Adding a money management option is easy but how to decide an appropriate lots is sophisticate for a grid trading EA. This should be the next topic we should discuss here. Owing to the fact that a grid trading EA is not like other EA that trade only one position at one time, grid trading EA will open many positions according to the market situation. So, what is the appropriate lot size for initiating a trade is hard to determine.

For a one trade one position EA, I can arrange a MM option according your MM policy that based on the account balance or free margin.

For a grid trading EA, I don't know how to calculate the initial lots according to your MM policy. If you have good idea of money management strategy for grid trading, please share on this thread and we can discuss whether or not the strategy could be employed for safety work.

--- 帖子 #872 ---
I agree on this one, add a option that lets say you set "risk 5% of account" then it will always be 5% and the lot size will increase with the balance

This would be the code for it FreeMargin()*Progressive_lot/1000.0

--- 帖子 #873 ---
No. I don't think it will work for Icarus. For Icarus or Robin does not have a real stop loss mechanism. When the price hits the stop loss, it won't close the position but put an additional position in. Hence, the risk of a grid trading EA, especially Icarus, is unpredictable. That is, if you set "risk 5% of account" then it is not always be 5% of account risk, but always loss 5% of your account. Why? You can set Account_Risk to 0.05 in the settings of Icarus, that means when your equity is less then account balance by 5%, Icarus will close all positions and accept the loss, even if it can further recover the loss to be a gain. That's why I say it is not 5% risk but 5% loss. Icarus is accumulating temporary loss for the potential gain when the price is swinging back. As long as your account can survive, the profit can be expected.

Once the risk is so unpredictable, it is no way to do money management control like you mentioned.

--- 帖子 #874 ---
Hi, her are my three cents on this topic...Trading with Icarus on a live account for years I never missed the option of the EA to adjust the starting volume on the balance. At least I check the EA once a day (normaly I can monitor it the hole day on my working space) and when balance goes significant up it is easy to change the starting volume by manual input. So from the trading perspective this function is IMHO not needed.

Having this said I would like this function when it comes to long term backtesting over many years. Everyone should be chrystal clear, the factor should be choosen super defensiv due to the fact we are not talking about a fix risk here, just about the starting volume of the cycle...

Cheers

Hi all, happy to see how this thread is growing.

I have been forward-testing Icarus for the past month or so, trying to see how a regular payout strategy would work-out. Did not have time to catch up on Robin's development : if I understand correctly, Robin is with-the-trend while Icarus is against-the-trend, right?

Also, it feels like Icarus is actually able to survive with multiple instruments at once: my objective is to

- constantly have low capital on account to avoid losing too much when the doomsday comes (such as earlier this week with FOMC announcements, which could have been avoided if I was aware of the red news coming)

- have multiple instruments to raise capital fast and withdraw regularly to secure profit and reduce at-risk equity

- have multiple instruments to generate balance in case one of the instruments is going downhill, the others (if weakly correlated) might help adding up to the balance and get out of the situation.

I plan on forward-testing both Icarus (which I optimized using StrategyTester) and Robin; are Robin's latest version's default settings okay to start @TeChaoLiang?

Cheers,

--- 帖子 #905 ---
As I mentioned before, never rely or believe my default settings. The default settings is for the purpose of testing my EA logic. For different symbols you have to find a better settings for you. If you like to use indicators trigger, setup what you like, and tune the multiplier of ATR to find a better multiplier. It is important to grid trading to have a appropriate grid size, not too large and not too small.

--- 帖子 #921 ---
Owing to the fact that Robin is a with trend grid trading EA, it is naturally with the hedging operation and that is not available for all USA brokers.

A better broker for Robin is with the following conditions. First of all, the hedge margin per lot is as minimal as possible, for example, if an one lot position is hedging to another one lot position, my broker takes hedge margin per lot is one tenth of margin per lot, the margin require for total two lots hedging positions is only o.1 margin for one lot position. And of course, lower spread, higher leverage, lower swap is preferable.
Attached Image

You can then go shopping around all brokers you know with the simple script attached and find a better one for you.
Attached File(s)   MarketInfo.ex4

6 KB
|
222 downloads

There are no big different of Icarus no matter of latest or old version. The different is only you can directly manually enter positions and you can set profit_lock to 1 with no problem. The trading effect of all version of Icarus won't make too much different. However, I dare not using Icarus on my live account except beginning with a small min lot, 0.01 or 0.02.

To the Robin, I am working out a better hedging logic. I also put my modify Robin into real live account. The new version of Robin I didn't share here yet. For one reason, because of my hedging logic is a little sophisticated, it is hard to be tuned if you don't understand how Robin dealing with the hedging. Comparing to cut off the loss positions manually, it is hard to explain how to tuning the modified Robin.

--- 帖子 #944 ---
OK. The spread of the first one is larger than the second one, means the first will earn you more money from each trade.

The MaxLot of first one is 5 times of the second one, means the first one encourage you put larger lots in your trade. Also,

the Margin required per lot of the first one is 1/5 of the second one, means the first one offers you a 5 times larger leverage than the second one.

Hedge Margin per lot is 50000 for first one means if you have two lots in hedging the broker only count 2*50000=100000, that is, only takes one lot margin. Also, for the second one, it only takes 0.5 lot less of margin.

Swap fee for the first one is cheaper than the second one.

Which broker will you choose? If only two brokers can be chosen, you should choose the first one. If there are other choices, both two brokers are not a good broker to be selected. Try to find a broker with Spread, Margin Required per LOT, and Hedge Margin per LOT as smaller as possible.

You have to noted that when your broker report a zero value to you, it does not means 0.  It just means Not Available.  For example, some broker will return 0 to Tick Value means it no tick value available for you.  But in this case, it will stop most of EAs from running, including Robin and Icarus.  The error message shown in the journal is zero divide in 'your_EA_name.mql4'.

--- 帖子 #951 ---
This script shows two kind of information, one is account information, the other is market information. Both information are easy to obtain. However, if you want to show all symbols for all market information as well as all account information, it is not easy to accomplish. Why? Firstly, you have to define what is all symbols. Different brokers provide different symbols to trade. All symbols is a vague description to write a script or indicator. Secondary, to show all information and all symbols in one page is hard to arrange the lay out. There are many market information can be obtained, but not all are needed, you have to specify which information is needed for you to select symbols to trade. Also, some market information are time variant, for example, the spread is normally dynamic. Frankly speaking, I don't think it is useful to choose symbol among all symbols to trade for a given broker. Rather, I think we should choose a broker for a given symbol to trade.

--- 帖子 #952 ---
The screen shot can not help me to find out what the problem is. Normally, the spread is relative larger than usual, and my default setting of max spread is 20 (in point value). Check your broker of the current spread, if the spread is greater than 2 (pip value), then Robin won't put order into trade. You can set max spread to a larger value, 60 for example, if you like Robin to trade at the larger spread situation.

When Robin shows green color but not gray color, means Robin is running.  No position open means not reached enter condition.  Current spread is less than the max spread is one of the trading conditions.

Note that, the spread is usually larger at Monday morning.

--- 帖子 #953 ---
The idea is to focus on all symbols information on one page. The information about the account is not required.

All dynamic information about the spread is essential.

It is useful to choose a symbol among all symbols is only when you wish to set up a basket for trading.

Your EA is well coded and you may have a basket-creating facility easily.

For the basket, you have to choose symbols whose movements are alike (positive correlation) and opposite (negative correlation) ensuring that pip value and pip movements are very similar for the symbols selected for the basket.

CFD symbols that are not based on futures use the Tick Factor as the value of the smallest whole unit movement of the specified instrument. It is the reference point used to calculate profit/ loss. Tick Value is the amount of profit/ loss made for a 1 tick move taken as the tick factor.

CFD symbols that are derived directly from the futures calculate tick values differently. It need not be a whole number. It could one fourth or 0.25 of 1 tick.  Futures exchanges establish a minimum amount that the price of a commodity can fluctuate upward or downward. This minimum fluctuation (trade increment) is known as a tick or commodity tick. A tick is any fluctuation in the price of a security.

Choice of broker has to be made after a shopping comparison offered by brokers portal sites like this one https://www.fxempire.com/brokers/best/cfd

--- 帖子 #967 ---
I don't encounter this situation, if trade is not allow, the buttons should be all gray, means market is close.  If not the case, may be the floating spread exceeds the max spread you set.  Also, if you use indicators for triggering buy or sell cycle, it won't has both buy or sell trade at same moment.  Unless you don't use indicators to trigger trades, it won't has both buy and sell trades at the same moment.

--- 帖子 #974 ---
GOod day,

Could we try this for ATR grid progression, with ATR. This feature allows for the GRID to be dynamic with the market both long term and short term.

HERE IS HOW:

ATR is used with value short term (3-6) and then a 100 MA. Once the MA is placed, a deviation line is set, from the MA. The deviation line is then the GRID spacing. This value will adjust with the markets long term changes. With the main idea of the deviation to be used to avoid short term spikes. Please see image:

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

Now that we have GRID spacing how will it be dynamic?

Then another deviation is used for short term. ATR has to be below the new deviation line before price can be entered.

2 confirming entry conditions:

Deviation 1 line sets the GRID spacing

***Side note about Deviation line, this line should be above 75-80% of the markets noise,

Deviation 2 confirms the ATR line is below the ATR deviation ( this ensures price has calmed down)

RESULT - Next order entry is x pipes away from the previous order, minus all the short term noise without being put into a huge thrust in the opposite direction.

"

double atr=iCustom(Symbol(),0,"ATR_Envelop",ATR_Period,Period_,Deviation,Deviation2,0,0);

if(Period_!=0) {

/*

agpm1=iCustom(Symbol(),0,"ATR_Envelop",ATR_Period,Period_,Deviation,Deviation2,1,0);

agpm2=iCustom(Symbol(),0,"ATR_Envelop",ATR_Period,Period_,Deviation,Deviation2,2,0);

}

agpm2=agpm2/Point/10;

As ATR is higher the GRID spacing increases allowing the GRID to increase its overall range to the current market conditions. The idea eventually tying the Lot size in but isnt necessary.

The end result is the GRID is able to develop of dynamic GRID spacing distance correlated to Account size, well at the same avoid the noise for entry, this allows GRID spacing to increase for the EA to handle the DRAWDOWN.

Here is the next part, analyzing the markets range in the past. This is a stats indicator I got. This gives us the thrust following the GRID spacing I outlined above. So youll see 20 x 20 gives us 54 orders. This means 54 thrusts occurred 200 pips followed by another thrust of 200 pips. Why does this matter for GRID trading?

On that indicator we set previous looked at bars 100000.

Result Only 1 move outside of the range the EA can handle.

And when did that happen?

After the FEDERAL RESERVE change monetary policy direction.

$$$$$$$$$

--- 帖子 #979 ---
OK, Here you are. But I don't think only use 4TF HMA as a trigger indicator will bring a good result. See attached below 99.9 quality Strategy Test Result.

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

Also, if you like to use this indicator other than its default settings, you have to tuning the indicator to be a good state and modify the settings to it source code and recompile it, so that the indicator will be called as you want. I don't like to put all the indicator's settings into Robin.

By the way, this is also a new version of Robin, named Robin_new_2.6. It has additional settings for dealing with hedging.
Attached Image
Where Hedging filter time frame is the time frame for hedging filter. I use the filter to filter out unnecessary hedging orders to prevent from wrong direction hedging order loss in SL.

Hedging filter multiplier determine the width of the filter band.

Profit lock for hedging position is a profit lock factor for hedging order.

When a hedging order is not reached its BE result but it is still profitable, Robin will close the order and also do a partial close of the hedged order.

The new version of Robin is attached follows.

--- 帖子 #984 ---
If you use 4TF HMA as the trigger condition it must all the four time frame HMA confirm a down trend, not the blue line. Once 4TH HMA first confirm a down trend, a red down arrow will be shown.

By default, yes. If you set "Selected indicators conjuncted apply" to false, then one of the indicators you choose meet the trigger condition will trigger the trade.

By the way, ATR is not an indicator for trigger purpose, it is for grid size calculating. BB, RSI, STO are MT4 default indicators, CoG and 4TF HMS are custom indicators.

--- 帖子 #985 ---
It is because the next trade trigger condition still not meet.  Some time there is no trade whole day or couple days, depending on the trigger condition you arrange.

If you doubt the EA is not running, just set all the indicator usage to false, then you will see there are two opposite trade open at the same moment.

--- 帖子 #987 ---
Hi Sifu, I m running Icarus_M.2.5_post848_BLSH now , the result look good . use original setting. running with few symbols. pls refer to chart. it trade with good profit but so much profit not sure why still not close the trade.

--- 帖子 #988 ---
No, you are right. Robin_new_2.6 has two phases to put the hedge, First it has to reach hedge condition that is you mentioned. Second, Robin will wait for a right moment to begin the hedge. Robin won't hedge immediately as the hedging condition is reached, if the trend is in ranging. When Robin find a trend is occurred, it then put the hedging order in. That is, there are two steps, needed to hedge and the right time to hedge.

Note that, Robin won't hedge a hedging order. If the hedging reach SL, Robin accept the lose and close the hedging order. If a hedging order is close due to SL, Robin will wait for an amount time and try to re-hedge again.

Also, I have a filter to determine when to hedge. By Robin_new_2.6 default, the time frame of the filter is H1. You can apply the filter to your chart at H1. If you see the price is below the lower line of the filter then it is the time to put a sell hedging order. When the price is between the upper and the lower line of the filter, Robin regards the price is in a ranging state and won't put hedging order in so eagerly.

Attached File(s)   Filter.ex4

11 KB
|
285 downloads

--- 帖子 #989 ---
My experience of how to use an EA
To use an EA, especially on a live account, you have to very understanding of what the EA is doing.

To understand what the EA doing, the better way is to read the source code of the EA. That's why I never use an EA without source code. If the EA is coded by yourself, of course, you are very understanding it.

Every EA I shared on the thread always with the source mq4 file. If you can't code a EA, you have at least can read the source file of the EA, or you cannot fully understand what the EA does.

Try to read the source code of an EA to understand the behavior of the EA. After you read enough codes of EAs, perhaps, you can code an EA yourself. And this is also my experience.

I have received many questions of why the Robin or Icarus perform like this. The answers is clearly in their source code, you just need to read.

If there is part of the source code you don't understand, you can post your question here, and I will explain to you. But, please do not ask questions that already have answers in the source code. Please try to read the source code otherwise the source codes I share here will be meaningless.

You don't have to read all codes of the EA, you just need put your attention on in what situation the EA will put a trade in and in what situation the EA will close the trade. That is enough for you to understand the behavior of the EA. EA put order into trade will through an OrderSend() function and close an order will through an OrderClose() function. You can then trace the source code the EA begin with those two functions. Where those function are used in the EA, you can use the search to find them. It is not so hard to understand an EA.

When you understand the behavior of an EA, you will better know how to set up the settings of the EA. To different symbols there are different settings suitable for them. You have to find out a better settings for the specific symbol. For instance, although I suggest you can run Robin on multiple currency pairs, but different currency pairs have their better or best settings, you have to take time to find out the appropriate setting via back testing. If you put Robin on multiple currency pairs and each currency pair with its better settings, then I think, your profit is predictable.

Finally, I will show a too good to be true BT results of my another EA which I didn't share it anywhere because this EA is not a grid trading EA. I running back test of 2021.5 ~ 2021.6 two months, beginning with an 1000 USD account, two months running result is 17420.60 USD. Dare I put this EA on my live account? No, I dare not. Because I think it just like a blind cat encounter a dead mouse. Even though the EA is coded by myself, I don't believe there is such a good thing. The result is far exceed my expected. The backward test will tell you something but not all, you have to run forward test on demo account to make sure the EA is running as you expect and stable enough.

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

--- 帖子 #991 ---
I can but I won't. Unless you can convince me why you don't accept the SL of a hedging order. Normally, we put double amount of lots to hedge a loss position, when the hedging position is reached its SL, meaning the hedged position is not loss so much than the time we doing hedge. Also, the loss increase from the hedging position is double amount of the loss from hedged position decrease. Not to close hedging trade at SL will increase your floating loss.

--- 帖子 #996 ---
profit_lock is a kind of trailing stop mechanism of the EAs on this thread. By the way, you have to specify which EA you are mentioned, we have Icarus and Robin.

Neither Icarus nor Robin employs a traditional grid trading strategy. They do not have a really SL mechanism but a virtual SL, also, they do not have many grids but only one grid with the grid size dynamically changed. To a traditional grid trading EA, your suggestions is correct and are already implemented in its code.

I think you have to understand the behavior of the EAs which we are discussing here in advance, before you give your valuable suggestion. For Icarus and Robin, there is no so called "each grid."

--- 帖子 #1004 ---

--- 帖子 #1005 ---
orders_follows=3 is your setting. That's why 0.3 lots. (3*0.1 = 0.3)

It means you use triple lots of min lots to chasing the profit. The following part of codes is using buy positions as an example to explain the logic to you, I commend the explanation as red.

// CASE 2.1 >>> We reach Take Profit so we activate profit lock

if(buy_max_profit==0 && total_buy_profit>CalculateTP(buy_lots[0])) //Reach virtual TP

{

buy_max_profit=total_buy_profit;  //Set Max profit so far

buy_close_profit=profit_lock*buy_max_profit; //Calculate close profit by profit lock

if (!Buy_Chased[buys-1] && orders_follows>0) //Perform profit chasing

{

if (buys<max_open_positions && buys<max_positions)

ticket=OrderSendReliable(Symbol(),OP_BUY,orders_follows*CalculateStartingVolume(),Ask,slippage,0,0,key,magic,0,Blue);

Buy_Chased[buys-1] = true;

return;

}

}

// CASE 2.2 >>> Profit locked is updated in real time When continue in profit, update max profit and close profit

if(buy_max_profit>0)

{

if(total_buy_profit>buy_max_profit)

{

buy_max_profit=total_buy_profit;

buy_close_profit=profit_lock*buy_max_profit;

}

}

// CASE 2.3 >>> If profit falls below profit locked we close all orders

if(buy_max_profit>0 && buy_close_profit>0 && buy_max_profit>=buy_close_profit && total_buy_profit<buy_close_profit) //Close positions in profit

{

if (total_buy_profit+total_sell_profit>0) CloseAllSells();

CloseAllBuys();

Buy_Chased[buys-1] = false;

With_Buy[buys-1] = false;

return;

}

If you don't like to chase the profit, just set profit lock to 1, then when virtual TP is reached the order is close immediately. Or you can set orders_follows=0 (that is "No. of orders with the trend" in your input settings), and the EA will send a zero lots fail order, the error message will be shown in your journal but no harm to the EA running.

All the answers of your questions are in the source code, please take time try to read it.

--- 帖子 #1007 ---
There is no way to use the buttons when you are running back test. The buttons only effected when you running forward test.

When you running a forward test or even on a live account, if you want put position in, you had better use the buttons or your position put won't have a magic number for the EA to take over control. But if you just want to close positions, you can directly close it from your MT4 terminal without using the close buttons. A closed position doesn't need the EA to take care, however, an open position needs the EA to follow up.

--- 帖子 #1009 ---
How to define the required risk? You can use Equity_Warning as a risk alert, the smaller the value is the sooner the Alert Red shown. Then you can stop the EA manually from your MT4 terminal.

Equity_Warning = 0.2  means the equity is 20% off from your initial deposit money.

https://www.forexfactory.com/thread/...4#post10293664

To understand the performance of Express, it is necessary to use all its control capabilities in backtest conditions.

I have been experimenting with various experts for a long time. Sometimes an expert makes a profit for two years in a row and finally blows up your account in a month. So it will be dangerous.

Live Market Testing (demo or real) offers few opportunities and options to explore.

The point I found in testing the various Grid system experts was that one of the key to their success was having the right risk with Rivard.

If your failure in Expert is more than your victory, Expert will not be useful

And if your chances of winning with a small profit are greater than the number of times you lose with a big loss, the expert still has no chance of success.

--- 帖子 #1013 ---
Dear Mr. TeChaoLiang

An important issue is using the clock setting in Expert

For example, when you set the start of the expert work at 8 am and the end at 1 pm, when the expert arrives at 1 pm, it stops completely.

This means that if you have a game cycle, it will be released

I think it is better to continue the last cycle to get results. Not to stop completely

--- 帖子 #1014 ---
An alternative choice is just stop initiating any new cycles, the not closed remaining cycles will still under managing of Robin. Which means, Robin will still putting orders to chase the profit and will still putting necessary hedging orders and doing hedge management till positions are all closed.

Attached is the alternative choice version.

--- 帖子 #1024 ---
Dear, Mr TeChoaLiang

When Icarus completes positions in a certain position and has only one position in profit on the other side and the trend is in favor of a position, the profit locks the correct position and no longer takes a position in that direction but positions opposite to the trend. Continues to lower the average.

The result is an explosion of the account in some cases, because if the trend is strong, martingling will destroy it.

Consider the following example

I tested gold. It was profitable for about 6 months, but in the last 10 days it blew up the account.

During these 6 months, this situation was repeated many times, but he was saved by chance, but in the last 10 days, he could not survive.

What happened was:

It took several selling positions on gold, but the trend suddenly changed. He took a position and entered the profit and locked the profit. He maximized gold sales positions but did not open any new positions in favor of the trend. The result was that due to the large volume of the tuberculosis position, the account died

I used the "number of orders for chasing profit" option, but it ignored the trend and added positions in both directions and vice versa.

I am not a coder but I try to read and understand the codes

It seems that a new "case" should be added under the headings (sells==1 And Sells>1) and (buy==1 And Buy>1) .

--- 帖子 #1025 ---
Icarus is not an EA my developed, I just modified it from the very beginning Ikarus which is the main topic of this thread. According to Mapi's requirement, I added many indicators for initiating a cycle instead of starting with a pair of hedging positions to initiate both buy and sell cycles at the same moment. Frankly speaking, I am not appreciated with Icarus, because it is a against the trend grid trading EA. Although it may profitable but also dangerous. Ranging market is favor for Icarus and a long trending market will destroy your account. Especially, you are using Martingale to increase position lots and not starting with a very small lots. That's why, I develop my Robin, which is a with the trend grid trading EA.

For a grid trading EA, Icarus or Robin, determine a appropriate grid size is important. The original Icarus (Ikarus) use a fixed grid size as you set in the settings. I added "ATR for grid size" for dynamically determine the grid size to trade. When you choose using ATR for grid size, the grid size in the settings is no longer effected. However, you have to aware that appropriate grid size for a with the trend grid trading EA and a against the trend grid trading EA is different. You have to tune it for good yourself according to the symbols you are trading.

I also found that there is no profit chasing mechanism in the original Icarus. That's why I added a profit chasing mechanism to Icarus so that it can chase the profit when the price activity is favor to the profitable cycle. I only let it to chase the profit at the last order of the cycle reaches it virtual TP. You can then adjust the value of profit lock together with number of orders with the trend to have a better effect. For example, if you set a lower profit lock value, say 0.3, that is when the total profit of the cycle is less than 30% of the max profit of this cycle ever reached, all positions of this cycle will be closed. Owing to the fact that the price won't just go straight up or down, a smaller profit lock gives you a potential to reach a higher total profit and update your max profit value. When you set the profit lock a higher value, say 0.9, you may miss the potential profit gain but at least you can receive 90% of the max profit so far, and the whole profitable cycle is closed.

Icarus is not my EA, I just add some additional mechanisms to it. If you choose not using any indicators, not using ATR to determine the grid size, not to chasing the with trend profit. Icarus behave as it original be. To the main trading control logic inside Icarus, I prefer not to change to keep it worked as it is. In fact, case (sells==1) and case (sells>1) can be combined into one case (sells>=1), I had combined them in my Robin, but I still leave them in Icarus.

Robin is my EA, I can do any change as I like.

--- 帖子 #1028 ---
Dear, TDV

Thank you for your explanation. It was useful for me.

--- 帖子 #1029 ---
Your understanding is correct.

Robin is a with the trend grid trading EA, It naturally has some hedging effect but not enough to recover the floating loss. So I manage hedging cycle separately for special dealing with the loss position. I do not hedge a loss hedging position, but take the loss. In this case, means the hedging is a wrong direction hedge, I try to take the loss of wrong hedging position when the loss of the hedging position is almost equal to the loss less of the loss position being hedged. When a hedging position reaches its virtual TP but not BE to the loss position, Robin perform a profit lock control, as the profit lock control is reached it close the hedging position and also do a partial close of the loss position, that will reduce the lots of the loss position.

Note that, Robin and Icarus are designed for trading currency pairs. When using on other symbols, you have to readjust the settings. For example, XAUUSD, the PIP value is 100*point value, but normally currency pairs PIP value is 10*point value, and ATR value is in point value unit. That means your setting of the multiplier of ATR, in order to fit an appropriate grid size for XAUUSD should at least 10 times of currency pair settings.

--- 帖子 #1044 ---
The codes seem no errors, I don't know why the hedging position is close in profit but the loss sell position was not closed.

Perhaps closing of sell position was not success? Are there any message from journal or Experts?

if (BE) // As the hedge reaches BE, close hedging buy cycle and sell cycle

{

CloseAllHedgeBuys();

if (sells>0)

{

CloseAllSells();

With_Sell = false;

BE = false;

}

return;

}

if(hbuy_max_profit>0 && hbuy_close_profit>0 && hbuy_max_profit>=hbuy_close_profit && total_hbuy_profit<hbuy_close_profit)

{
// At this point although not reached BE, but hedging positions are going to be close due to profit lock. We do a partially close of the lost sell position.

CloseAllHedgeBuys();

Hedge_remove_Time_buy = TimeCurrent();

if (sells>0)

{
double partial_sell_lots = NormalizeDouble(sell_lots[sells-1]*total_hbuy_profit/-sell_profit[sells-1],2);
double remain_sell_lots = sell_lots[sells-1] - partial_sell_lots;
OrderCloseReliable(sell_tickets[sells-1],partial_sell_lots,Ask,slippage,Green);

SL_sell = CalculateSL(remain_sell_lots,1);

With_Sell = false;

}

return;

}

In your case, it should close the hedging position in the situation BE and the sell position is also closed after the hedging position is closed.

--- 帖子 #1058 ---
So far by now, you don't have to pay attention on the message showed, because I didn't take care of the show message part. I suggest you disable show message on the settings. (The show message part is inherited from Icarus, for Icarus, it is OK, for Robin, I am not sure.)

--- 帖子 #1059 ---
new 2.7 is a modified version of new 2.6, the former is when off the trading time window stopping initiate new cycle but keep manage the positions that not be closed, the later is when off the trading time window stopping all operations.

if you don't restrict the trading time, new 2.7 and new 2.6 are indifferent.

But 2.7 is another story, it is a special version for forex1x8 who asked for adding WPR as an triggering indicator. However, I don't think WPR will bring a better result, so only Robin 2.7 has the special indicator WPR.

Normally, the later the version number be, the more complete the EA.

Also, every modified version, Icarus or Robin, I share here you can read from my posts of the posts near by my post before to understand why doing the modification. You can easily to find every versions I share via my personal information Forums Attachment.

--- 帖子 #1066 ---
Hi, profit_lock: Percentage of profit secured by trailing stop.

So when the cycle is hitting the target (red or blue line), this is the percentage of € wich is protected by trailing stop...

Cheers

--- 帖子 #1072 ---
I have to say that there is no EA will long live survive if you put arbitrary parameters in the input settings. To a grid trading EA, grid size is critical to profitable or burn your account in the end. I have given the option of using ATR to determine an appropriate grid size for Icarus as well as Robin. You must aware that a grid size suit for Icarus is not suit for Robin, because their grid trading logic are totally different.

Here comes a question that is how to find an appropriate using ATR? I am going to illustrate for you. First of all, I always like to use 5 hours average data to be the ATR calculation base. 5 hours average ATR could be calculated from H1 period 5 or M15 period 20 or M5 period 60. I'll take M15 period 20 as the illustrating example, and we are going to find what multiplier will give us a better dynamic grid size for the symbol you trade.

You can then running optimization on your MT4 strategy tester. Select ATR multiplier as the parameter to be optimized. Set the start, step, and stop value to find a better value within the start and stop value. See the attached picture:

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

In this illustration, I use history data from 2010.9.1 to 2121.4.30 to run the optimization. As you can see, if you choose ATR multiplier in the green block, it of course will burn your account. Don't ask me to modify my EA because you are setting a wrong parameter for ATR.

If you choose multiplier from the red block, your account is safe and profitable. There are many criteria to select a multiplier value to use.

You can select one with maximum profit or select one with minimum DD rate, it is up to you.

Normally, as I have selected a parameter for ATR multiplier, I will use this value to run BT of other time period, for example, from 2021.4.1 to 2021.7.31, as a verification of the parameter is stable and OK.

--- 帖子 #1075 ---
Well, it depend on which EA you are running.  For Robin, you have to keep enough free margin to guarantee the EA will work normally, that is, one min lots for normal position and 2 min lots for hedging, total of margin need for three time of min lots.  For Icarus, you have to predict the max positions and the progressive lot size of each position to calculate how much free margin is enough to guarantee the EA work normally.

Anyway, reduce your min lots will reduce the drawdown percentage.

hello, thanks to Mapi for the launch and moderation This thrrad, and to you for your great support.

I am a hobby trader, but I can also programming on the medium level in MQL5 since 3 years.

Currently, I am at the stage of analyzing the requirements and assumptions for EA that perfectly fit the Mapi thread and your observations above.  unfortunately, regular work means that I cannot devote myself to this activity 24/7

If Mapi agreed, maybe it would be possible to deal with the whole thread about EA studies and development based on an intelligent grid

also if Mapi and You agree, I will share the specification of this Strategy/EA here, and maybe it will shed some new light on ideas, and make better next versions of EA.

My strategy is based on several assumptions: 1) the moment of entry is not that important 2) the most important thing is to have a system that is 100% adaptable to the conditions that appear on a regular basis 3) an ideal system is one where there are no rigid parameters, e.g. "grid size"

--- 帖子 #1080 ---
To me, I am very happy you can share your experience on this thread but it still depends on Mapi because this is his thread.

I agree with your assumptions. For a grid trading EA, the moment of entry is not so important. I hope we can develop a grid trading EA that can sense real time price action from the market and adapt itself to follow the price action. ATR for grid size determination is one of the mechanism to auto fit the market price action, but it is not enough. We need a totally adaptable strategy and control logic for the EA to run on any market situation. For instance, a trend market favors the with trend grid trading strategy, a ranging market favors the against trend grid trading strategy. Then, how does the EA can sense or feel the market is in ranging or trending is the first issue. Also, how to switch between two strategies to fit the market PA is the second issue. How to manage two different strategies in one EA is a final issue. Do you have any idea of above issues?

I would like to share what I have learned to beginning the informative discussion with you. I have learned that almost 30% market PA is in trending and 70% in ranging. To a trending market, I found we can use real time ATR to determine a better TP so that we can earn as much as we can. For example, if we can tune a set of parameters for ATR (time frame, period, and multiplier) to fit the symbol you are going to trade, the result is very profitable. To implement it, we don't set any TP of a position to enter the market, we check the real time ATR value to determine whether or not we close the position in profit. Take XauUSD as an illustration, the PA is trend up in May 2021 and is trend down in June 2021, a simple EA that enter a trade based on any potential trending indicator, use support/resistance as the SL and real time ATR to take profit. Run the EA from 5/3 to 6/30, beginning with 1000 USD, 0.7 lots for each trade, at the end, we have 16316 USD in result.
Attached Image (click to enlarge)

I need to learn is what is the better trading strategy for a ranging market?

--- 帖子 #1082 ---
What's timefrime to use?

--- 帖子 #1083 ---
You can select whatever time frame you like. Only time frames choose for indicators are needed. Before you select time frames you can draw the indicators on the chart to see what time frames for what indicators you are going to use to trigger a trade. To the ATR settings, you have to trial and error to find the settings suit for the symbol you are going to trade. You have to do yourself, no one can help you.

When you run a back test, I suggest you use 1M time frame and every tick mode, that will give you a more accurate testing result. If you run fore test or run live account, no matter what time frame you select for the chart, it will work according to the indicator's time frame you selected unless you choose current time frame for your indicators.

--- 帖子 #1084 ---
How about drawdown filter?

If maximum drawdown more than 50% , close oldest orders

Should be?

--- 帖子 #1085 ---
No, it should not be. To a grid trading EA, close the oldest order won't help but will destroy the EA's normal functions.

You can run a forward test on your demo account, when you find the DD is more than 50% you close the oldest order manually to see what happens.

Do test and verify your suggestion before you propose a new idea. Also, share your test results here to justify your idea is a good idea.

Also, to have a drawdown filter the EA has to determine real time value from equity. But the equity reflect the whole equity of your account not the drawdown for EA you are running. If you have another trade on another chart, the equity is also include the floating profit or loss of other trade.

--- 帖子 #1086 ---
From what I understand, the original EA opens buy/sell at the same time and will do it's hedging functions. But the later EAs with indicators, only buy or sell depending on the indicators. This main different make the original and later EAs not the "same" anymore. MaPi, which version are you running live now?

--- 帖子 #1087 ---
Thank you Mapi and TeChaoLiang for your consent.

Over the weekend I spent a bit on the analysisi and coding and it dawned on me that trading with the grid is nothing more than trading with Stop Loss, only SL it is created in a specific way.

Finally, this whole grid-based "entry/exit" model generates specific coefficients, such as:

1. Proft Factor

2. Recovery Factor

3. Sharp-Ratio

4. the Z-Score

Following this way, treating the model as a black box, you can generate n-variations of the model that will give similar indicators as "grid" model, and will not be based on the grid

In "grid" way that it is easier to accept the loss, because it is somewhat "hidden" behind the n order positions. It is different with the traditional SL and TP. Where SL touches us immediately and we feel emotions here and now. In grid, emotions are spread over time, the losses are also the same as in the traditional model, as no bigger.

Next thing is the strategy entitled:

1. Do I want to add to losing positions, hoping that their direction will change

2. Do I want to add to the earning positions, hoping that they will be even greater.

My trading nature is that 2

For this reason, I started my research and verification of various theses that may lead to what in the future.

I created a separate thread for this. Nevertheless, I will stay here with you because, as you know, it is always worth talking.

--- 帖子 #1098 ---
Basically, The Hedging mechanism of Robin is like the concept of zone recovery strategy. But I just let robin takes only one round of hedging. The reason is if you don't have enough free margin available. A sequence of hedging operating will increase you margin requirement very quickly and you have the risk of burning your account.

I would rather to take the loss of my hedging order as it is hedging in wrong direction. Because when the hedging position is in loss, then the loss position to be hedged is also decrease its loss. I like to close the hedging position when the amount of loss of the hedging position is almost equal the amount of the loss decrease of the loss position being hedged.

--- 帖子 #1099 ---
Hedging is an art. It requires the presence of mind and an ability to take risks at points where the chances of hedging going bad is small.

Like Scale/grid entry, Hedging strategy needs a scale/grid of releasing locks.

It will work beautifully if you trade futures where swaps costs are not imposed.

Only MT5 is certified for futures trading. Not CFD trading. Only AMP futures provides CME futures trading.

So you have to develop MT5 EA.

I lock in hedges whenever I feel like sleeping, going out or facing compressed range trading giving no scope for release locks or taking any risk.

Maximum hedge can be kept for 3 months or less depending on the date of futures expiry.

I have kept it up to 2 months by hedging and bringing the margin to a neural. If I hedge with loss locked, only the loss will be less from margin capital.

If hedged with profit locked, then the margin will show more money.

I hedge with a profit of 50 pips if I want to take it to the exhaustion resistance level and then release Buy hedge with 50 pips profit locked. Giving space to the bear position to lose from profit plus some more risk money loss. I have seen most of the reversion moves take place from an All-time high after 12 H4 candles.

Dax has hit all-time high last Thursday and I am waiting for the reversion to take place. I have released my long position and waiting for a short position to

travel to the open of a long position, which is 120 pips away. At the moment I am making only 10 pips from the hedge released after waiting for 4 H4 candles.

This observation is for the DAx symbol.

Likewise, each symbol has to have a similar probable pattern (not guaranteed always). You have to draw a grid for your symbol dividing the daily range into 16 pip grids.

From 16 pips grids, you identify the reversion spots. It could be retracement or reversal.

You convert stop loss logic into hedging logic of using opposite direction to trade for exit on the hedging broker platform. No exit by way of stop loss.

It is like a semi-automated EA where you can't have the logic of using technical indicators to set up hedging. Hedging can only be done by a constant (not dynamic) of pips or % distance. You can always shift to manual trading to execute pyramiding or increasing positions depending on your reading of the price action or time action or understanding of the hot markets that can help you exit fast by ramping up positions. This kind of knowledge comes from experience or practice on demo.

Equity index trading is a fascinating game because of high volatility and momentum happening around known hours of Market Open, Market Close, Market converging with other markets, and gaining liquidity. Semi automated mode using EA like a wild horse rider during open of the market works well. But greed always takes over and it becomes difficult for the EA to rein in the wild horse. Only manual traders can handle hedging.

Forex volatility is 1/3 rd of index volatility and reversions happen too often. Only experienced traders can handle forex easily and that too in a semi-automated mode.

--- 帖子 #1102 ---
I happen to have used hedging this morning in my real trading account.

I was losing 300 pips on nasdaq last night for positions sold. I simply locked  the positions by buying in oppsite directions when my.margin % in terminal showed trades moving closure to liquidation after 30 pc more drawdown. So today after 18 hours expecting retracement liquidated bought positions. For an hour I saw margin capital touching 101 % and then it turned around and I ended up with gains from buy positions liquidated and gaining breakeven in my sold positions and margin at 114% showing profit .

So time given for the lock to work (18 hours in.my case) room given for relaese of lock to work (unhedging took 1 hour)  can be put in the  rules linkedd with margin deposit % if you want to use EA .

But key is coding the  timing of the lock release.

If some thought is given to it, EA can be deployed for releasing the locks in an orderly manner.

As a manual trader I took the call depending upon my reading of the market. But my experience says EA can be coded.

--- 帖子 #1104 ---
Entry , TP and Hedging lock and unlock, relock all  can be triggered by using  margin level % rather than any other trading logic..

Risk management logic will trigger entry when margin level is say 200% at open time of market. Open time is your rationale for trading.

You dont need any other reason to trigger entry.

You have to have bias for up or down direction.

You can trigger trade at 200% , take profit

when margin level increases to say 220% and hedging happens when margin level drops to 190%.

I think this EA will work well.for indexes because open trading hours attract most volumes and provide a reason to trade.Even without a direction bias random trading can produce good results.

--- 帖子 #1105 ---
[quote=simnz;13671280]{quote} Entry , TP and Hedging lock and unlock, relock all can be triggered by using margin level % rather than any other trading logic.

. Risk management logic will trigger entry when margin level is say 200% at open time of market.

Open time is your rationale for trading. You dont need any other reason to trigger entry. You may have bias for up or down direction.

So tming is with open hours. Logic is heavy bidding takes place during first open hour

You can trigger trade at 200% of your margin, take profit when margin level increases to say 220% and hedging happens when margin level drops to 190%.

I think this EA will work well.for indexes because open trading hours attract most volumes and provide a reason to trade.

Even without a direction bias random trading can produce good results.

--- 帖子 #1109 ---
I forgot to mention that timing is crucial for hedging positions to be unlocked . Essentially, you have to calculate what YOU think could be an exhaustion point for reversal of longs and an accumulation point for reversal of shorts.

For this I study volatility statistics linked to hours and week days to know the pattern which I can use for fixing  my probable exhaustion and accumulation points. 80 % of time it works for me.

I focus on identifying exhaustion points and trading hours linkage  by looking at statistics available on the net or by rquesting passionate Excel orogrammers to generate csv spreadshhets.

I am an Excel novice and would be happy to work with an Excel programmer to transfer my knowhow with no expectations. . Commonsense trading by EA or manually without doing any kind of news or topdown analysis.

Only oneoff effort at styuding Excel Reports .

No backtesting required. Trading methods are proven at producing 80 pc returns.

Which hours, which week days and what times are good for trading .

Which margin level for entry, TP and Hedging is good also will be based on Excel studies/statistics from 3 months of trading demos.

Designing Excel sheets is a one-time job. It is like developing a milching cow.

--- 帖子 #1110 ---

This kind of strategy forces you to be a disciplined trader.

--- 帖子 #1118 ---
Hi everyone,

I have been following this thread since the beginning and kept on thinking of a way to create the ultimate EA that could - with a smart payout - be profitable.

Most pairs fluctuate between ranging and trending, without it being easily predictable. What about we take a step back here? If those instruments are not suitable for grid trading, why don't we try creating one?

- What happens if instead of grid trading on one instrument, we trade the difference of two correlated instruments - supposedly, something that's ranging in time? The only issue I would see here is double spread cost though; also, buying EURUSD and selling AUDUSD comes back to buying EURAUD but then again the idea remains the same, maybe some of those pairs are naturally more ranging than others?

Illustration: currently, if we run Icarus on EURUSD, it would open both buy and sell cycles with it. What would happen if it both "buy EURUSD and sell AUDJPY" and "sell EURUSD and buy AUDJPY" and behave the exact same way, but considering that new instrument there?

- Another idea: let's say we start grid trading on one instrument, things start going wrong; how about we kind of "accept a reasonable SL" here and move on to another mostly uncorrelated instrument to start from there?

Any thoughts?

--- 帖子 #1122 ---
Anyway just to add on, i have been using the TMA+CG on 56 (halflength), 6 (price) , 3.0(banddeviation) for sometime now and scalping on indices especially US30 on a M15 chart..Even though i know that the TMA +CG is repainted, i still love it as it gives me a good reference to overbought/oversold situation.

Hence thats why i am trying to see ways i can innovate with the TMA+CG further.. probably a grid strategy within the channel might work?

Currently my idea is to just create a "grid strategy"  that buy/sells only.

For example, prices hit outside the lower channel and reverses back and re-touches the channel, the first buy will be activated.

A buy "grid" strategy will then be activated in the channel with reference to the opposite channel.. within this channel, the "grid" strategy will do buys within a grid (distance between upper and lower channel).

So the idea situation will be that all the buys made on the grid within the channel hits th the upper channel for a TP

But if it doesn't and prices decide to whipsaw or reverse within the channel, the "Grid" strategy is able to at least average out the trades for a small profit considering the spreads/swaps if any

I really like the idea to decide on the basis of margin level %.

I trade with patience and putting faith in hedging and reversion happening in a few hours and with a plot planned on the basis of statistics probablity study of TP and reversion duration .

The beauty of indices trading is you don't have to have BIAS for direction. Selection of HOURS is really important.

Directional bias is also OK (it may give you some kick if you are proven right) but I avoid it because I am not an insider and unlike a designated market maker, I don't have access to order books.

I try to track the big boys footprints on the chart , I succeed sometimes and fail sometimes. But I don't give up.

I don't aspire to be a forecaster and prefer to enjoy watching the game to gain insights from Price Action, Time Action, Volume Action. That's all.

I have made trading life simple and manageable. I don't trade to kill boredom. I trade to make passive "Less Loss but lots of gains" money consistently and this is all I teach through a social non-profit organization that helps retirees and pensioners earn passive money and help university finance students get entry-level jobs in the trading sector by using live cents trading records as testimonials.

I do feel Margin Level% and using Time hours as the logic is a good candidate for EA coding. Avoid all kinds of money management rules. Focus only on

Time, Directional Bias (option yes or No). If Yes, choose long or short. If No, allow random trading by ticks .

Lots Management: standard

Margin Capital: Calculated by margin equity and margin level% Both displayed on the chart

Working time: Start and Stop for 8 times to remain as default for Open, Converge with other markets, News, Close.

Displayed on the chart:

Risk controls: (displayed in a data window on the chart) limited to

Equity Loss by Margin Level xxxxx%

Equity Profit by Margin Level: xxxxx%

Entry logic:
Focus on single trade for the present. Not multiple.

Grid trading (not martingale) can be taken up after this EA is tested and perfected.

GUI

Entry conditions

Trade by Direction: (yes) Long or Short .

If No,

Trade by Random ticks filtered on the basis of first xxx ticks.

(a) consecutively long or short: x (example 5 ticks)

(b) x (after accumulation of 5 ticks not necessarily in a row)

If (a) select buy or sell . You can chose long ticks and trade short or long

or (b) select buy or sell; You can chose short ticks and still trade long or short

Example: If first 5 ticks are buy, then trade only BUY direction or wait for accumulation of 5 ticks to trigger

(c) No Long or No short: Any ticks which means no filtering is applied. Purely random

Exit:

1. TP for single trade (a) distance in pips (b) price in percentage (c) margin level % xxx%

2. Hedging : ( instead of stop loss) , positions will be hedged by (a) distance in pips (b) price in percentage (c) margin level % xxx%

Risk Management

No trail required, no breakeven, Stop loss (optional)

--- 帖子 #1132 ---
After the last candle is complete then buy/sell signal is calculated and shown. That is, when you observe the signal shown, your buy/sell order could take place at any price within the current candle.

The trigger condition you gave to me is just "when it signals." Attached is the code for your indicator.

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

In the red box, where 3, 1 means buy signal occurs at the last complete candle. 4, 1 means sell signal occurs at the last complete candle.

You can take the value of upper or lower line using 1, 0 (upper line of current candle) or 2, 1 (lower line of previous candle). Of cause you have to declare two new variable to take them. Modify your trigger condition on line 2743 and 2748, when done, recompile the code.

If the trigger condition is specified as: "when it signals and current Ask <= lower then buy" and "when it signals and Bid >= upper then sell," the EA should be as attached.
Attached Image (click to enlarge)

Attached File(s)   RobinTMA+CG.ex4

126 KB
|
257 downloads
Attached File(s)   RobinTMA+CG.mq4

219 KB
|
382 downloads

--- 帖子 #1134 ---
A few points missed:

1. The EA should not trade live if there is a risk of a margin call based on margin% which means the margin% should be at least 110% or more.

2. Always use brokers who close at 100% of margin deposit. By choosing such a broker, you can use them for momentum trading. If margin is 110% when you open entry. you don't have to worry for Stop Loss because trade will cease at 100%. 10% of margin will act as your risk. If margin is 130% (100% stop loss, 110% entry point, 130% profit target). Your profit risk return ratio will be 1: 2

2. Never use brokers who close at 0% of margin deposit because you will lose entire money. 100% of margin should be 5% or more of the contract value. The risk of negative balance will also be there and a broker can demand more than your deposit loss.

3. Leverage will help you in executing more trades, but it will not help in increasing your dollar value. If your broker is offering you 5% of contract value, calculate the risk of 5% if it covers your perceived risk in pips Room for risk has to be given. Entry should start at 10% and upwards. Exit by loss will be automatic at 5% and exit by profit will be at least at 15%.

4. New entry option: Entry by TF also can also be another option for index trading. Open of any TF starting from M1 to W1 (for time action traders).

5. New Exit option : (hedging not required) Exit by any TF closing can be used but will not work on M1. If trade opened in M1, can be closed in any TF from M5 onwards.

6. Please don't make it complicated by introducing Breakeven, Trail profit or loss, etc. Trade only single position of any lot size.

7. EA is based on profit factor where profits exceeded losses. Winning rate is not important.

--- 帖子 #1135 ---
I downloaded Robin_new 2.7 and checked it there is the same problem in backtesting. The thing is when for example the EA opens a long position, and it goes toward the TP line, at the exact moment of touching the TP line and closing the long order, it takes a new long and closes it simultaneously with the first position. Therefore, there are 2 closed trades which one of them (the second one) is in loss of spread amount.

Check the attachment please to clarify.

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

I can see the code lines to check where is the problem but I need time to do it. So first I have to know is it for everyone? Or is it just in backtesting not in forward test?

--- 帖子 #1136 ---
It is normal. If you set the profit chase (No. of orders with the trend), when the long position reaches the TP, it begin a profit chase that is what you saw a new long position is opened, it also perform a profit lock, when the total long profit less than the profit lock it close all long positions.

If you don't like to chase the profit, just set No. of orders with the trend to zero. If you like to close the position when TP is reached, set the profit lock to 1,

--- 帖子 #1137 ---
Hi guys, I've been following this thread for a while now and have been testing Icarus myself. I have been trading FX for a few years now, though just got started on EAs. I use a signals EA for my manual trading, which I created on Fxdreema, but that's about it. I've been running Icarus 2.2 live for about a month on a 1k account with quite conservative settings (20 grid, 0.02 lots). It's up about 12%, which is fine. Problem is, it's obviously a small account (1k) and I'm not going to invest big in something that's been proven to crash sooner or later.

I've backtested various settings with 99.9% quality (data from Dukascopy) going back to various stages of the market...latest is 2016. My conservative settings can withstand even the killer moves from February till December 2020. Even if I start the backtest from 01.01.2020, it survives! I say even, because the beginning is the most critical stage, where your account is still building up. With every profitable trade closed, your chance of getting a margin call gets smaller. So according to my backtests, it survives even if we start out with the large moves of 2020. The problem there of course is, it doesn't make a lot of money...you'd have to have a 50K account to make a decent living where I'm from (Switzerland). Am I going to risk 50K on Icarus? Definitely not.

So we have to increase lot size. Now, if I run my 1K account with settings of min. 0.1 lots, I double my account in 1.4 months (average of 01.2021 till 07.2021). Now, how do we not get stopped out? I think we need to keep it as simple as possible. Icarus 2.2 does fine with no indicators or fancy buttoms. How about when the max positions are opened and the trend continues against us, we just open a hedge trade manually, larger than the total positions going against us? If the trend continues on, we'll eventually hit 0 and close everything out. On a 20 grid EurUsd max positions is quite a trend...and it's been proven many times that trends on average go much further than you think. If the trend stops after our manual hedge trade, we just book the loss of said hedge once the original grid closes. Any thoughts on that?

I also backtested 0.1 lots min on my 1K account starting in 2019. While starting in Jan 2020 would get you stopped out, starting in 2019 lets you be up 10K by the time 2020 comes and the account survives. So you'd have to be quite unlucky to start Icarus right into such moves of 2020!

Any thoughts on this?

--- 帖子 #1138 ---
Did you prepare your history tick data using tick data suite? It seems to me only tick data suite will show you a 99.9% quality. But to my knowledge, it is impossible to have a 99.9% quality when back testing on MT4 because MT4 is not like MT5 that generate all time frame data from tick value.

Tick data suite will plug it code into MT4. Once the plugin exist, no matter how poor your history data are it always show you a 99.9% quality when you check use tick data on the back test.

I had examined via two MT4 terminals with different history data to run back test with same symbol and same period of time. The results are quite different. But tick data suite shows me a same quality of 99.9%. Then, which result is the accurate one?

As a conclusion, I don't believe the 99.9% quality what tick data suite shows.

--- 帖子 #1141 ---
Concerning my hedge, what I did now is the following. I tested with the EurUsd for the year 2020 because it's the worst. Minimum lots is 0.1, 6 max positions, 20 grid, progression 3. Whenever the 6th position opens (0.8 lots), I immediately open a hedge in the opposite direction double the value of the 6 positions combined...so 4 lots in this case. If the trend continues, I close out all trades after 100 pips at breakeven. I then wait and start the EA again when I feel the trend is over. If price goes gainst the hedge, I close out when the EA closes its positions and I take the loss on the hedge.

Of course this is very hard to backtest. I used my tick data for the backtest and everytime I see a 6th position opens, I then go to my actual charts and look what would have happened, had I opened a hedge. From this I move on through the year. This way of testing is very vague at best, but I'm not a programmer and could never implement this on my own.

--- 帖子 #1142 ---
Use an EA to auto trade is different to doing a manual trade. You had better has a very understanding of the trading logic of the EA. How to understand the trading logic of an EA? There is no better way but to read the source code of the EA. Even if you don't know how to code an EA, at least, you should print out the source code and read it to understand its trading logic.

To my understanding of Icarus, your hedging trading logic is weird. Icarus is basically an against the trend grid trading strategy, it performs no hedging unless at the beginning it initiate a pair of hedging positions.

If you think applying a hedging mechanism will help Icarus, then why don't you apply hedging at the first moment? Why you have to wait it reaches the max positions and then begin to hedge? However, if you apply hedging at the first moment when a position reaches its virtual SL, the EA will be turned to be a with trend grid trading EA. And it is never be Icarus any more. It is Robin in this thread.

Icarus manages two cycles of positions. One for long and one for short. When you hedge a double amount of lots against to a loss cycle, then, your hedging position will be under managed of the opposite cycle. If you want your hedging position be separately managed you have to define another two cycles to manage them, one for hedging long, one for hedging short.

Icarus is not my EA, I don't like to change its trading logic too much. Ranging market is favor for Icarus, when you expected a long period of trend could occur, the better way is stop Icarus manually before it crashes.

--- 帖子 #1143 ---
Hi TeChaoLing, thanks for your input and all the work you've done with Icarus and Robin. First of all, let me say, I'm not in the least suggesting you to change the EA...this is Mapis idea and a lot of people like you have put time and effort into Icarus (and Robin). I'm only explaining how I use Icarus at the moment, and that I'm doing it manually because I can't code. In my view, there will always be the need for manual intervention, as many have stated before.

I believe I do know how Icarus works...the system is after all not that complicated. I know that at some point, a continuous trend without decent pullbacks will eventually crash the robot. I think we can both agree on that. So as you say, we could turn Icarus off, when we expect a large trend. But at what point would we turn it off? When a cycle is closed? Or when one cycle reaches 5 positions? Or 6? I think guessing if a large trend is coming up and turning off the EA is not that reliable...if we could accuratly do that, we wouldn't have this problem and we'd all be millionaires. And when do you turn it on again? What if you turn it on and a huge trend starts? What's the exit strategy? You could of course just put in a stop loss of course. What I just know from experience is, if a trend is strong and goes for 100 pips, odds are high that it will rise another 100. Then your out. In any case, you either get to close out the EA and start fresh without a loss, or you lose your hedge. The goal has to be to somehow get out to restart the EA at a better level. What is your solution for getting out when you see the trend is strong and you've hit the 6th position?

And why wait to the 6th position? First of all, this hedge prevents you from making money and stops the EA from losing (unless your hedge idea is wrong). So I'd like to hedge as little as possible and let the EA make money in between. You get a much larger ranging are for the EA to make money if you wait for the 6th position. The trend it takes to get there is much stronger than lets say at the 2nd or 3rd position (increasing the chance that it will continue after the hedge trade). When it can range, the EA does make a lot! So I want it to run as long as it can.

So broken down: Instead of going bust, the max you can lose is the hedge trade. I'd say more than 70% of the time, the hedge will help you close out the EA without loss.

Am I not making sense?

--- 帖子 #1144 ---
You are a passionate trader .

I would appreciate if you could backtest an EA designed by me for index trading only.

My extensive manual trading experience is invested into it. I am not a discretionary trader. I don't use oscillarors or moving averaging indicators.

Information indicators are used by me extensively.

I don't know Excel, mql or any programming languages. Not good even at backtesting.

Because of experience, can design trading logics.

https://www.forexfactory.com/thread/...3#post13564063

I have been practicing hedging for almost 8 years now. It gives me peace of mind, allows me to take breaks any time and I find index mean reverts often. Though August has been a tough period when only two times I got pullbacks while all the time all indices were moving in touching All Time Highs and reversing with a very small compressed range.

It is as if merry go round chair swing are going on. The race among all the index is as to who will touch the ATH first and move away.

This has resulted in compressed daily ranges. My drawdown has been between 18% to 2%.

Continously, for a few days you have to keep the lock on because the daily range of high low is quite low , and you can't afford to do multiple times of locking, unlocking and relocking, raising your blood pressure or feeling psychological pain.

Maximum unlocking should be 4 times in a week. If at all 4 times in a week, pullbacks happen you make good money. If 2 times relock then small profit or breakeven. If it is 1 time relock less drawdown. Maximum drawdown happens when 4 times you are forced to re-lock.

Overall, if hedging is done with patience without getting bored, 70% of the time I have made money.

But whenever 4 times pullbacks have happened in a week, the gain has hit up to 300% in a week.
Consistent yearly profit can be up to 150% if you are good at timing of locking and unlocking them with profits.
This has been my experience.

--- 帖子 #1147 ---
You can give it a try. I'm not saying I found the holy grail, just a method to try out. Remember that I use a 20 grid, so much further apart than the original 5. So as an example, if your min. lot size is 0.1 on Eurusd and you use the Fibonacci grid size progression, you'll be down 1560 USD by the time the 6th position opens. Another 100 pips in the same direction and you'll be down 3560 USD. So in these 100 pips your hedge has to make that amount = 3.56 lots on EurUsd. If you want, you can also put a SL at breakeven, if price goes like lets say 50 pips in favour of the hedge.

As TeChaoLing has mentioned, you could also just turn off the EA when you expect a large trend, but in my view, this goes a bit into what you are saying about feeling the trade will pull back. If we can say what the market will do more than 50% of the times, you don't need a robot, do we?!  Plus you have to turn it off in the beginning, 5th or 6th position will be too late. And what if a large trend starts when you just opened again?

--- 帖子 #1148 ---
Hi All,

Currently i'm testing Icarus M 3.3, i read from first page until this page.

Can someone explain what the different between below Bollinger Band setting ?

Inserted Code //+------------------------------------------------------------------+
//  BB trigger Icarus M 2.2.4
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+
bool BB_Buy()
{
double BBL=iBands(Symbol(),BB_tf,BB_Period,BB_Dev,0,PRICE_CLOSE,MODE_LOWER,BB_Shift);
double BBU=iBands(Symbol(),BB_tf,BB_Period,BB_Dev,0,PRICE_CLOSE,MODE_UPPER,BB_Shift);
if (BB_Mod==ASK_BID && Ask < BBL) return(true);
if (BB_Mod==HIGH_LOW && Low[0] < BBL) return(true);
return(false);
}
bool BB_Sell()
{
double BBL=iBands(Symbol(),BB_tf,BB_Period,BB_Dev,0,PRICE_CLOSE,MODE_LOWER,BB_Shift);
double BBU=iBands(Symbol(),BB_tf,BB_Period,BB_Dev,0,PRICE_CLOSE,MODE_UPPER,BB_Shift);
if (BB_Mod==ASK_BID && Bid > BBU) return(true);
if (BB_Mod==HIGH_LOW && High[0] > BBU) return(true);
return(false);
}

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+
//  BB trigger Icarus M3.3
//+------------------------------------------------------------------+
bool BB_Buy()
{
double BBL=iBands(Symbol(),BB_tf,BB_Period,BB_Dev,0,PRICE_CLOSE,MODE_LOWER,BB_Shift);
double BBU=iBands(Symbol(),BB_tf,BB_Period,BB_Dev,0,PRICE_CLOSE,MODE_UPPER,BB_Shift);
if (BB_Mod==ASK_BID && Ask > BBU) return(true);
if (BB_Mod==HIGH_LOW && Low[0] > BBU) return(true);
return(false);
}
bool BB_Sell()
{
double BBL=iBands(Symbol(),BB_tf,BB_Period,BB_Dev,0,PRICE_CLOSE,MODE_LOWER,BB_Shift);
double BBU=iBands(Symbol(),BB_tf,BB_Period,BB_Dev,0,PRICE_CLOSE,MODE_UPPER,BB_Shift);
if (BB_Mod==ASK_BID && Bid < BBL) return(true);
if (BB_Mod==HIGH_LOW && High[0] < BBL) return(true);
return(false);
}

--- 帖子 #1151 ---

--- 帖子 #1152 ---
BB trigger for Icarus M 2.2.4 is buy at low and sell at high. While BB trigger for Icarus M 3.3 is buy at high and sell at low. Note that Icarus is an against the trend grid trading EA. It makes profit mainly via the against the trend trading. That is, when a position reached its virtual SL, it added another order against the trend and accumulated losses progressively. When the trend is reversed, it turns the accumulated losses to profits. The more the losses it accumulated, the more profits it takes from the price reversal. BB Trigger for Icarus M 3.3 is let Icarus to accumulate the losses as soon as possible.

It is a intuitive thought that using BB as a trigger indicator to buy at low and sell at high in a ranging market. But it is only for one trade one position trading. To an against the trend grid trading, one trade with many positions, if we follow the intuitive thought, we are not taking the advantage of the grid trading strategy of Icarus. That's why I developed another BB trigger condition that buy at high and sell at low for Icarus. It is Icarus M 3.3.

Indicators are neutral depending how you use. For instance, if you use BB together with CCI (+100, -100) to trigger buy at high and sell at low, you will have a good trigger condition for a trending market. If you use BB with RSI and WPR to trigger buy at low and sell at high, you will also have a not bad trigger condition for a ranging market. I had implemented two single position trading EAs for trending and ranging market. I didn't share them here because they are not grid trading EAs. But I can show you a back testing result of the EA for trending market. Begin with 1000 account balance, XAU 0.3 lots, from 2021.01.01 - 2021.07.30, the result account balance is 14709.10 as the attached graph shown:

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

--- 帖子 #1155 ---
Sorry, I can't share my EA. The main reason is once I share my EA, the EA will become a free EA to every one.  I can not sell the EA in the future.

But I can share how the EA be developed to you.  As I mentioned above, the enter condition is BB+COG, I use ATR to automatically calculate the TP as well as SL.  According to SL:TP ratio, I use ATR to calculate SL and sending order with SL set, but no TP set.  When the price hits the SL, it exit with loss, when the price hit the instant TP calculate from ATR, it closes in profit.  It is quite simple, and you can develop one for you.

The difficult part to use such a simple EA is the settings tuning.  You have to tune the BB parameters (time frame, period, std), you have to tune ATR parameters (time frame, period and ATR multiplier), also you have to tune the SL:TP ratio.

Normally, if the trading strategy is determined a simple EA can be coded in couple hours.  But to tune an EA for a specific symbol to make it works fine will take me couple of days. If you want to use an EA on your live account, you had better to know how to tune the EA.  Any EA could be profitable if it is well-tuning.

--- 帖子 #1157 ---
Spread 0 only a bit unrealistic to the real case but no harm to determine whether or not the EA is OK.

My screen shot is not a screen shot of Icarus. The trigger condition is BB+CCI, that is price reaches BB up band and CCI > 100 then buy and price reaches BB low band and CCI < -100 then sell. This trigger condition is trying to catch the moment that price go side walk along with BB up or low band. If the condition is met, it is very possible a trend is occurred. However, this trigger condition is only for my simple EA, and totally a with trend trading. So, this condition may not suit for an against grid trading EA, Icarus.

If you want to find a better indicators for Icarus M 3.3, I suggest using BB to buy at high and sell at low with the filter of RSI within 32 to 68. That will indicate a ranging market. By the way, the RSI indicator in Icarus can not be set to as a trigger filter of within 32 to 68, you have to modify the codes for it works. The simplest way is to add your filter condition at lines 1328 and 1496 of the source code of Icarus M 3.3. The condition to be added is iRSI(Symbol(),RSI_tf,RSI_Period,PRICE_CLOSE,RSI_Shift) > 32 && iRSI(Symbol(),RSI_tf,RSI_Period,PRICE_CLOSE,RSI_Shift)<68

For example, change

if(!stopNextCycle && !restAndRealize && Indicators_Buy()) to

if(!stopNextCycle && !restAndRealize && Indicators_Buy() && iRSI(Symbol(),RSI_tf,RSI_Period,PRICE_CLOSE,RSI_Shift) > 32 && iRSI(Symbol(),RSI_tf,RSI_Period,PRICE_CLOSE,RSI_Shift)<68)

When done, recompile it.

Your buffer numbers are correct. Only a minor problem that you should use Ask in the buy condition and Bid in the sell condition. But that is only to your enter price of a spread difference. You will buy at the price a little higher than the LowerBand1 and sell at the price a little lower than the UpperBand1.

If it still doesn't work, try to set the shift of buffer 2 and buffer 6 to 1 but not 0. I am afraid that the buffer values are calculated till the current candle is completed, that will cause you could never get a value on current time frame and not trade will be triggered.
