--- 帖子 #1559 ---
I was not talking about manual intervention or using Buttons.

Automated trading approach needs clarity to map out the whole process and make rules that an EA can understand and execute.

Building Grid pending order set up needs

(a) Start Price (normally it is market price) for Buying Limit

(b) Top Price ( TP) , above market. Profit Zone. Grid stops after exiting with take profit.

(c) Bottom Price (BP) below market and below TP. Drawdown zone. Grid gets stuck here if pullbacks cease .

(d) Accumulation steps for drawing the grid

What I am suggesting is setting up of a micro grid (PPT) or partial profit zone between the Profit Zone and Drawdown zone to take partial profits

It is in PPT grid rinse and repeat cycle will take place. Ideal trading environment is sideways/ consolidation/mild trending only.

In PPT zone after take partial profit, pullback takes you back to the entry point, adds new position and the cycle continues as long as the pullback keeps touching the past entry price and generating buy orders.

It is easier to construct rules for EA to execute trading where orders would be repeatedly put back when the pullback touches the original order placed .

--- 帖子 #1579 ---
Hi TeChaoLiang,

Can you please make a semi-automated EA version of Robin that draws double grid based on following market conditions for HEDGING purpose only

(a) Strong trending - NO HEDGING

(b) Moderate trending

(c) Sideways (shuttling between support and resistance)

(d) Sideways drift (compressed moves)

An automated EA can also be used to enter (b), (c) after any indictor or logic has identified Strong Candles losing momentum speed. Strictly to enter after Big Candles have slowed down after trending has hit peak or bottom.

What Traders have to do:

1.

Estimate Exit by pips size of TP or SL based on volatility statistics for all four market conditions

Estimate Exit by Bars Numbers or Timeframe based on News time/Open/Close Hours

Trader to select Timing based on a view (formed by using indicators or not).

Trader can make an educated Guess. EA can't do that using any of the technical indicators that easily.

EA can do for (a) Strong Trending: UP/DOWN: Use Buy/Sell Limit (accumulate by pullback) + Buy/Sell Stop (providing further thrust to buying/selling ).

2. Hedge or not?

Hedge provides natural risk management by setting up double grid without the use of breakeven or trailing stop. Only required utilities for Equity loss or profit controlled by Close all or close with profit or close with loss.

Ideal for (b), (c) and (d) conditions. Not for (a) which needs independent risk management by the use of Breakeven, Trailing Profit, Margin% lock (equity loss stop or profit equity increase exit)

If hedging is allowed by the broker platform, then buy and sell can be done for same symbol.

If hedging is not allowed (FIFO or Netting) , find symbols of same asset that can be used in opposite direction

3. Trader wanting to do natural hedging without depending upon locking or unlocking has to take a firm view on Timing

(b), (c), (d)

4. For natural hedging, EA makes risk management easier by counting increase or decrease in equity and exiting by Close All, Close with Profit, Close with Loss linked to Margin% increase or decrease.

(b) ,(c) and (D): Use Buy Limit +Sell Limit for UP direction. and for DOWN direction use BUY Stop + SELL stop

User has to take a firm view on how to use Support and Resistance, Fibos, BBs, MAs, Envelopes, Boxes, etc. Key will be the location of the grid or distance between

the high low range. It needs some planning as to a middle point where prices are likely to turn.

If trader decides to time it by entering via EA, then EA can use any of suitable technical indicators. Though my preference is for the trader to watch chart and then decides the likely points of exhaustion after determining the Range to be traded.

Second phase will involve setting up of Partial Profit Trading for Double grid.

--- 帖子 #1583 ---
Please see the 1st post.

gs_progession: Factor to expand grid_size0 = Disabled, all orders will have the same distance 1 = Distance between orders will grow 1/2/3/4/5… (D’Alembert) 2 = Distance between orders will grow 1/2/4/8/16…(Martingale) 3 = Distance between orders will grow 1/1/2/3/5…(Fibonacci)

--- 帖子 #1597 ---
3 of them are explained in post 1...last option is starting both cycles when indicator trigger is used...

Cheers

--- 帖子 #1598 ---
GS_Progression is set grid size progression. 0 means keep the same size, 1 means 1, 2, 3, ..., 2 means 1, 2, 4, 8,..., 3 means 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8.

Account_Risk use to control account risk, value from 0 to 1.  If set to 0.3 means when equity is less than the account balance by 30% of account balance will close all orders and stop.

Show_Forecast 0 or 1, 1 means show the forecast information on the chart.

Initiate Both Cycle When Indicators is used means when indicators triggering a trade will initiate both buy and sell cycle.  Original Icarus does not use indicators for triggering trade, it just beginning with both cycles at the same time.  Select false, buy and sell cycle will be initiated separately.

--- 帖子 #1609 ---
It is all described at the first page of this thread. The settings use “1”, “0” or true or false because that settings go directly as values that the code understands. It would be counter productive to make a drop down menu with “Martingale” this will just complicate the code.

The least you can do is to read this thread very well to understand all aspects of this wonderful Bot.

It’s not hard. And once you understand better, you can formulate your own settings for your liking.

--- 帖子 #1623 ---
Hi Mapi, I am a fan of your work. And I thank TeChaoLiang as he has not hesitated to help me understand the basics of Icarus and Robin,  and ofcourse other contributors in this thread.

I would like to share some of my strategies for Icarus, and I wonder if you can give some validation to my techniques.

i do not have your exact settings for Icarus,

But i do know that you are using fixed grid settings. There will come a time where there will be 1 way trend and the only option for fixed grid setting is to add money as buffer if trend is really strong. Otherwise, we would experience margin call. That is my life even before i studied Icarus. We can limit this by using triggers, i am using BB as trigger which makes my trades more "intelligent" - more of a sniper waiting to trade quick and clean, and i do not use "Initiate both cycle" as this also causes out of place trades that can cause unwanted drawdown.

My backtest workflow is to have a priority of low maximal drawdown in 1year period, and then slowly work my ATR Settings to give me a grid and TP multiplier that will improve my profit and yet still minimize my drawdown. I think this is the answer for Grid trading, contract grid for tight range, and expand as needed so that Drawdown will not be too big.

My dream is to not ever add capital to my trading account because of drawdown.

Maybe it is soon possible. With a little more work.

I am attaching a sample of my backtest result for january to december 2021.

AS you can see, i was able to lower maximal drawdown to less than my initial capital of 1,000.

My return may not be too enticing in "backtest". But if I get this result in the real world, then I am more than happy. It's a great result.

I have also proceeded to run this setting with Live money today.

Wish us luck.

i forgot to attach,

here it is:

--- 帖子 #1624 ---
i am just basing my answer on your chart.

As you can see, you have 3 trades all close to each other, if you intended to only have 3 max trades, then your trades are too close to each other.

You have 2 choices,

1. add to max trades so that when market goes to a pullback or retest, then you would easily Take profit.

2. Widen your grid, so that those 3 trades wont be too close to each other.

I suggest to tweak your settings to add some more trades, and adjust your grid size and TP.

For your question about stop loss, at that example, you will lose a lot of money, better change your settings forst before considering SL. You can use the hot buttons for stop loss, close all sell or close all buy.

--- 帖子 #1625 ---
We already have this, look for Farzad's version of Icarus, it has Hedging function. I have been able to have good back tests in such a way that i am saved from margin call, but it will affect your overall profit. It is not bad to consider, and depends on what your overall strategy is, it can work.

--- 帖子 #1643 ---
Hi,

Happy new year !

I have converted Ikarus EA v4.31 modified from mt4 to mt5.

Nothing has been changed about logic, changes have been made only to adapt mql4 to mql5 platform.

For orders and positions which are differenr in mt5, I have used the great library of Fsaber : MT4Orders.mqh

I meet some issues with stdlib.ex5 , so , I joined in archive zip the file <errordescription.mqh> to copy in mql5 include folder.

I have just tried on a 15 mn chart because I have not to much time: it seems to work, but it needs certainly to be improved.

Let me know about your mql5 tests.

Mike

--- 帖子 #1652 ---
Oh sorry I have just forgotten MT4Orders.mqh to copy with errordescription.mqh in mt5 include folder

For Killervsr, a .mq5 file is codesource for mql5.

You copy this mq5 file in Experts folder, and Metatrader5 will compile it to ex5 after restart (or refresh).

I have joined ex5 file in this zip file

Use files in this zip files because I find issues to display the right panel.

--- 帖子 #1657 ---
I cannot say if it is a bug or not on mt4, if we find the same reaction, it means mt5 version is like mt4 version.

Mt5 EA uses exactly the same trading logic as Mt4 EA, so we normally find the same reactions with mt5 EA.

I don't modify the original trading logic.

Report just if you find big differences between mt4 and mt5.

If mt4 EA is released , I will release mt5 EA (when I have time)

--- 帖子 #1665 ---
I am trying to understand how it is going on your screenshot.

I start here a visual backtest

On this screenshot, (EURUSD M10) you can see a buy trade triggered by EA, the price goes up,and the dash line goes up also and after stay waiting.

At this time , you have equity which can grow very high over balance but like the cycle is not closed , it can stay a long time like this , it's why you have the green equity line moving far over the balance line.

During this time, EA can start also other cycles,so it is difficult to analyse really. But apparently, Icarus is not wrong and makes his job correctly.

- On your screenshot, when you have the big down peak , Icarus triggered another cycle,and has compensated and we can see this in load at the bottom of the tester

On this screenshot , after when the price goes down to the blue dash line , the cycle is closed, and the profit is taken.

I hope I am not wrong and I think it's not really a bug.

Maybe somebody could explain better with more precision, it should be nice !

--- 帖子 #1667 ---
You can do like you want, all is free.

Converting a complex EA like Ikarus from mt4 to mt5 is far to be easy,

I just ask reports to make this EA running better on mt5.

For pb with indicators you have to look at :

input bool Conjunct_Idx = true;  //All selected indicators will be applied together

I join version which work on demo account only.

If you want to use it on a real account, at your risk  you have to comment by yourself the line 16 (#define DEMO 1) in the mq5 file.

--- 帖子 #1683 ---
Yes you can have a "swing" account which removed a lot of the requirements but other prop firms are probably better. I think TPT using a copy trade to copy the trades to MT5 may suit Icarus better in the long run if my test works as they have less trading restrictions (and a lower 8% target for qualification) but for testing purposes FTMO give the best trial account type with set time period and full desktop/analytics.

The weekend trading should not really be that much of an issue as we could use the timers to turn Icarus off mid way through Fridays and close any remaining trades off at a loss just before market close. The main issue with FTMO would be the rules about trading around big news events for specific currencies.

--- 帖子 #1702 ---
You have to aware that the symbol property of XAU is different to currency pairs. PIP is a unit specific for currency pairs. That is, for every currency pairs, one lot is 10 USD per PIP. However, for XAU, if employing PIP unit, one lot is 1 USD per PIP.

This is not to say you cannot run Icarus on XAU. But you have to know the difference of symbols properties to set a proper settings.

--- 帖子 #1715 ---
OK an update on my test running ICarus on all 28 pairs simultaneously with a view to using it for prop firms, I have been running it on FTMO trial accounts.

Settings (basic) were:

Bollinger off

Stoch on at 20/80

RSI on at 20/80

Initiate both cycle off.

Grid multiplier D'Alembert

Lot size multiplier Fibonacci.

It generated very good profit with very low drawdown normally, however the week before last got caught in a couple of pairs when the JPY collapsed and last week/this week has got caught in 2 CAD pairs where the CAD has rocketed due to the price of oil increasing suddenly - both instances caused the 5% drawdown limit to be breached.

I have set it running again in this latest test with Bollinger turned on, I initially turned it off as from testing the MT5 version of Icarus the Bollinger over ruled the other 2 indicators - but it then became evident that the MT5 code translation was flawed so I don't think this will be an issue with the original MT4.

Couple of ideas for additions/amendments:

a) Invert trigger - at the moment this seems to just do the opposite of the signal, so if it's activated instead of opening trades when the 20/80 bars are breached it will open trades when the price is within the 20-80 range.

I think perhaps an alternative/addition would be to invert the direction of trade when in one-directional trade mode. So at the moment for instance when the 80% line is breached it opens a sell as it is expecting the price to bounce back below. How about an option to invert this so if the threshold line is breached it instead opens a trade in the same direction to trade with the momentum of the price?

b) A chart based stoploss centered on the "P/L Sym" figure so if Icarus is running on multiple charts and one chart starts to get away past a user defined amount ($100 or so for example)  then at a certain point the trades on the pair are closed as a safety measure and the loss is taken while allowing the other pairs to continue trading.

Update on activating Bollingers - reduced the number of trades taken by about 20x with ASK/BID setting, have set it running with HIGH/LOW instead to see if that still restricts but if it does I will be turning Bollinger back off for the next test run.

I will wait until this FTMO trial is over and the final figures are in. However I *think*, had there been a stop loss of, say, $400 per chart it would have stopped these 2 CAD pairs getting mired in drawdown (I don'ty remember seeing any other chart going anywhere near that figure into the negative). They would have closed off at a combined loss of $800 but Icarus will still have made enough profit in the period to pass the required profit target and keep drawdown to about 2-3%, the previous test where it got stuck with two JPY pairs would have definitely passed. Either way it would have protected the 5% drawdown from being breached and ended up with a free re-try on a proper challenge, which you get if you don't pass the profit target but also don't breach 5% drawdown.

Next test run will be with keeping an eye and trying to manual pull the plug on any chart than goes more than $xxx in negative, using the stop/close button already featured in Icarus, hopefully in good time. I do think there is great potential here for Icarus to do well with prop trading though.

--- 帖子 #1730 ---
Found a significant bug in the ATR grid routine.

It seems to stop increasing the grid past a certain price and then when the price hits that target each time the EA still opens a progressive lot size trade according to the lot size multiplier that is set. Had it happen twice overnight on CADCHF and also USDJPY when the price moved against the trade.
Attached Image (click to enlarge)
Attached Image (click to enlarge)

You can see in the second list of trades above USDJPY grid price stopped increasing somewhere between 113.328-113.334 and in the attached chart below you can see all the additional positions that were opened as the price moved down and back up past the target price in the same 1M candle.
Attached Image (click to enlarge)

The USDJPY eventually went as far as a 197.0 lot trade (from an initial 0.20 lot start) before closing out in profit but this is an account blowing error and I'd advise the ATR grid option not be used until it is resolved. Of course this can be avoided by setting a limit on the number of positions the EA will open to about a max of 6 however but that comes with the risk that a trade will not close out in profit very quickly.

--- 帖子 #1733 ---
I encounter this also, try to have a larger period for your ATR. what happens with ATR with small period is that sometimes you are given a very small grid size for one cycle, this makes the trades too close to each other and would really risk a blown up account. That is my experience. So i always use a higher TF and a larger period, thismakes the grid contract and expand not too abruptly.

I hope i helped.

--- 帖子 #1738 ---
ATR grid size is only using ATR to calculate a dynamic grid size when every new buy/sell cycle is initiated. When using ATR grid size, the Take Profit of the settings is also override a new Take Profit. When in the cycle (buy or sell) ATR grid size won't interfere any of the trading logic, such as gs_progression and progression.

For a grid trading EA, grid size choosing is critical to profit or loss. In other words, you have to tuning the parameters of ATR for well to give you an suitable grid size for trading. ATR grid size is just replacing the fix grid size setting at the moment of any buy/sell cycle is initiated. However, since Icarus only have one variable for grid size, once a new grid size is calculated, the new grid size will be applied to all cycles even the grid size when determine at the moment of another cycle initiated is not equal to the new grid size, the new grid size will replace the old grid size.

If want each cycle has its own grid size, we have to declare two grid size variables, one for buy cycle another for sell cycle. But to do this will change a lots of codes of Icarus, so, I intend not to do it. If someone is interested, he can modify the codes of Icarus as he like.

As a conclusion, when employing more indicators in trading the trader has to have more knowledge of the indicators he use. For different symbols, different brokers, the appropriate setting of indicators is also different. NEVER NEVER ask others what his settings are, because your broker is not the same as his broker. You have to find out the optimal settings for your broker as well as the symbol you are trading by yourself.

--- 帖子 #1753 ---
No, it is totally irrelevant to the grid size progression. No mater what the grid size is determined, buy manual setting or by ATR, the grid size progression is base on the determined grid size to calculate the virtual SL. As attached source codes:
Attached Image (click to enlarge)

the variable grid_size once determined, never changed within the whole cycle unless a new cycle is initiated, and this is the only place Icarus refers to the value of grid_size to calculate the virtual SL.

Also, gs_progression is use in the CalculateVolume() function to calculate the volume of the last position, and use to calculate virtual SL as shown above.

It is no reason that ATR_Grid_Size() will affect the grid size progression behavior of any form.

Attached Image

--- 帖子 #1756 ---
Do you really understand ATR indicator? If not, don't use Atr_Grid_Size() to determine the grid size.

For if your ATR settings is not proper, and calculate a very small grid (close to zero or zero), then the grid size progression won't work.  Because any number multiply by zero is zero.  From your post 1742, it seems that you have a zero grid size.  That's why the EA will keep on adding new positions progressively till the max positions is reached.

--- 帖子 #1757 ---

Have to understand ATR well, to use it. I swear by it, it works wonders for me. Because i am able to control it to my style and strategy.

--- 帖子 #1760 ---
No, I did not code the EA to have a max size of grid. There is a setting of max_position that you can set, the default should be 6. Means only open at most 6 position in a cycle. (I did not code this part of Icarus, it remains the same as original Icarus).

Atr_Grid_Size() only give you a dynamic grid size to Icarus, no more and no less. Many people have tested Icarus and also tested ATR function for several months. You are the first one to have such issue of ATR. Perhaps you can check the Journal to see whether or not there are error message. If you are running fore test, also check the Experts to see if there are error message.

Also, as I have mentioned before, do not trust the default settings of any EA. If you understand those indicators you can tune them for good or you should not to use those indicators. The original Icarus is without any indicators to decide the moment to open a position and/or for helping to decide a grid size dynamically. In fact, a grid trading logic doesn't need indicators to trade. I have my own grid trading EAs, with the trend or against the trend, I didn't use any indicators. Before you use any indicator, I suggest you should run Icarus without applying any indicator first. Then, if you hope to have a better result, you can try to apply indicators one by one to see whether or not the result comes better.

Even I use ATR for grid size, I also have to tune the settings of ATR symbol by symbol as well as broker by broker.  For different symbols have their different price actions, also the optimal settings of ATR are different.  Different brokers have different spreads for symbols and they are affect the profit you can have in a trade, that is, the appropriate grid sizes are also a minor different.

--- 帖子 #1778 ---
Yes. Robin's hedging filter works for a given range of price, when the price is within the range will not do hedging. Because Robin has a separated cycle to manage hedging orders and the hedging order when reach its stop loss won't hedging the loss hedging order any more and just receive the SL. The hedging filter is use to prevent the hedging order hit its stop loss frequently when price is wandering between the price range. That is, prevent from hedging order SL and re-hedge another hedging order again and the new hedging order also hits its SL, and again,....

--- 帖子 #1779 ---
Hello all,

I found a scenario and I think this scenario will lead us to lose a lot of money

I will suggest a solution and I hope if we all think together to find a better approach

——————————————————————————————————————————————

Example
Order 1 - Buy 0.01
Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08
Order 7 - Sell 0.08 -> Hedge order

then the sell will close the first buy order on profit

Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08

——————————————————————————————————————————————

I suddenly found the program opens 2 orders at the same time

5 old orders
Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08

2 new orders
Order 7 - Buy 0.08
Order 8 - Sell 0.08

Order 7 opened because we already under the next buy level

and Order 8 opened because we have to hedge at this point

but if we looked at this scenario we open 2 orders with the same lot and in different direction

There are no meaning of opening 2 new trades at the same price in different direction

——————————————————————————————————————————————

I think one of the solution could be adding a new parameter to choose the number of opened orders we want to hedge

so if we set this parameter with 2 for example

The last scenario will be

5 old orders
Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08

2 new orders
Order 7 - Buy 0.08 -> opened because we already below the new buy level
Order 8 - Sell 0.16 -> The hedge order = the sum of the lots of the last 2 orders

so this hedge order now has a meaning and do its job

——————————————————————————————————————————————

I hope if all of you can say his own opinion about this idea, if it will fix this problem or not

or if there is any better idea for sure we are trying to reach the optimal solution

Thank you.

but what if we are in a buy cycle and the price still going down

we will end up with

Order 1 - Buy 0.08

Order 2 - Buy 0.08

Order 3 - Buy 0.08

Order 4 - Buy 0.08

Order 5 - Buy 0.08

Order 6 - Buy 0.08
Order 7 - Sell 0.08

--- 帖子 #1783 ---
Yes its really awesome, If we can made some enhancement I will really appreciate it.

Lets assume our grid size and progression = 3
and we are in a buy cycle

Order 1 - Buy 0.01
Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08
Order 7 - Sell 0.08

If order 7 and order 1 closed on profit then we will continue with orders

Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08

We will not open another Hedge orders
but we will check if the price now is less than or equal to the next buy level we will open another buy order

Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08
Order 7 - Buy 0.13

If the price continues we will open a new hedge order

Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08
Order 7 - Buy 0.13
Order 8 - Sell 0.13

and so on ..
If the price go up again we will close all the order when they reach the TP
because the Buy lots are greater than the sell lots
so we can close it on profit

and If we can add the number of hedge orders as an attribute it will be a huge advantage for example

Order 1 - Buy 0.01
Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08

if the attribute = 2
then

Order 1 - Buy 0.01
Order 2 - Buy 0.01
Order 3 - Buy 0.02
Order 4 - Buy 0.03
Order 5 - Buy 0.05
Order 6 - Buy 0.08
Order 7 - Sell 0.13

Thank you in advance, I really appreciate your contribution.

First Scenario

GridSize and Progression = 1
Attached Image (click to enlarge)

as we can see here, we have 6 orders and this is the max number of orders but the prices goes up and didn't open any hedge orders

Second Scenario

GridSize and progression = 3
Attached Image (click to enlarge)

As we can see here, the first hedge order opened and closed with the first order successfully.

but after that there are 2 hedge orders opens at the same time one buy and one sell

and we already reached the max number of sell orders = 6 orders

I think we removed this feature and we always opens only one hedge order in the opposite direction

so we can close the orders even if the prices goes either ways on profit

Can you please tell me if I can understand correctly or not

because I can not find the different between the 2 versions so I may missed up something

Concern
I have a concern, what if we closed and opens alot of orders in the same cycle it will end up with the following scenario
6 * Sell 0.08
1 * Buy 0.08
So the buy hedge order will never closed with the first sell order because they have the same lot amout
That is why I were asking to open the hedge order by the sum of the last 2 orders so we can always close some of the orders on profit

--- 帖子 #1811 ---
Two areas you have to consider before starting the EA.

Is the market choppy or going to be choppy?

Is the market congestion happening or going to be happening?

You simulate such situations, create scenarios and then find solutions and whether tool can cope with it assuming you correctly identfied such market environment.

Sideways will work with any kind of hedging but how will you forecast the birth of Sideways market? Use an indicator or your eyes?

--- 帖子 #1812 ---
For me, Hedging should be done only when your grid is maxed out already. The martingale/fibonacci grid should take care of a certain range in the market. Hedge should kick in when the grid strategy is out of range already.

That is my style that i implement on Icarus.

--- 帖子 #1813 ---
Hello Simnz,

As you said any grid ea will be awesome and profitable if the market was in a sideway, but what if we entered using indicators or our eyes or any method and the price moves in one direction for a long time 100% we will lose our money

So the solution is to set a SL or to hedge

My Style:Using indicators to try to enter in the right direction one (Only one direction at a time) I preferer the hedging approach if the price moves in the opposite direction I want to thank All of you specially Romike for implementing the grid partial close, this feature moved the EA to another level and fixed the normal hedge problem

--- 帖子 #1814 ---
No trade should be done without protection. It could be SL for individual trade or Equity Loss.

I have practised hedging to protect vis a vis using SL for more than 10 years and my experience says only those with deep pockets can succeed.

I have the mentality of selling naked options, so I am OK with this kind of approach. The market-making business model is to flush out weaker hands.

From what Investopedia says, I have used Range Trading quite profitably. I have no experience with trend grid trading.Grid trading involves placing buy and sell orders at set intervals around a set price. The grid can be created to profit from trends or ranges. To profit from trends, place buy orders at intervals above the set price, and sell orders below the set price. To profit from ranges, place buy orders at intervals below the set price, and sell orders above the set price. I wish you all the best for your efforts to tame Hedging for short-term automated trading.

--- 帖子 #1816 ---
Hi guys, thanks for this amazing modification of SMG !

Been using it for ages and was very happy to stumble upon this thread.

USAGE :

Fire up the Template 1 on GBPUSD H1 timeframe (or anything else with enough juice to move sometimes

Template 1 : This is CCFP indi set to WEEKLY LEVEL 3. Renews on sunday market opening ONLY. This is your way to see the only pairs you're gonna trade.

Then analyse the pairs in left corner. CCFP Indi gives you BUYs and SELLS. Disregard all other pairs. Then use for every pair told :

Template 2 : For your LONG PAIRS, timeframe H1 or less for entering earlier than grid would do.

Template 3 : For your SHORT PAIRS, timeframe H1 or less for entering earlier than grid would do.

Best entries for me are when CO_END_OF_TREND and channel-signal new indi all line up and a candle close in other direction happens.

See the pics for this week's trading direction and setup.

I presume everybody knows where to put the files. Indis into indicators, ikarus into experts folder, and the templates ... guess what.

Won't answer questions to this matter, please do some homework.

This should be an example where the market might be headed to, and to use this wonderful tool. CCFP WEEKLY LEVEL 3+ ONLY, pairs on H1 each.

Go. Enjoy taking the H1 dips into the big weekly moves. One direction a week per pair. Easy setup on Sunday. Stop if you have enough, I try to do so on wednesday and finish off the remaining on thursday.

Cheers, George

DISCLAIMER : lotsizes are set for big accounts 100k and up. Please demo and adjust accordingly. For 0.01 starting lots I'd recommend 10k account size and more.

Forgive me if there are errors - no responsibility taken in any case. Martingale is dangerous without proper money management.

--- 帖子 #1823 ---
Hello, I want to say thank you for sharing the EA. I think it's a robust EA better then most on the market and it has a lot of potential. I've now been using an hedging EA for 3 years, it's connected to an neural network do do a little risk management and works like a charm. DD's can be huge but it never blew up an account as long as you have followed the risk guidelines.

I've been testing Icarus the last days a lot and I would like to suggest and try out a few ideas, see how they would go.

The first suggestion I'd like to make is the position sizing or position progression that the hedging EA that I use works with.

It starts with a statical order progression for the first three orders and then it continues the progression with a geometrical raise, now after reaching a certain number of orders when it wants to add a new order to the grid, it closes the first order of the cycle to then continue the grid further.

It would look something like this;

order 1. - 0.01 lot

order 2. - 0.01 lot

order 3. - 0.01 lot

order 4. - 0.03 lot

order 5. - 0.06 lot

order 6. - 0.09 lot

order 7. - 0.12 lot

order 8. - 0.15 lot

order 9. - 0.21 lot

As you see it starts statical and then adds per 0.03 position from order 4 to 8 and then at 9 it added 0.06 on the position and that's the furthest I've experienced it go. Now depending on the equity left of the account it will close the first position for a loss to be able to add a new position to keep the grid going and that way it should be able to go for a long time and keep a low realized loss of less then 3 or 5 % because the first positions are small.

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

Then I'd like to suggest if you can make an option for true or false that the hedging feature after X orders to continue the cycle position sizing that it hedges.

And an option to chose for true or false that the new opposite cycle or new signal also continues the previous opposite cycle position sizing, please.

Other then that I would say keep up the great work, I think you have a powerful tool here!

--- 帖子 #1836 ---
In my experience hedging has worked largely because I adopted manual Accumulation and distribution approach. However, now I believe it can be coded with simple logic of using Excel formula for fixed-line Depreciation (for distribution pattern) for Opposite trade in Sell mode. Can also use double depreciation by having a multiplying factor.

For Buy mode,  compounding formula has to be coded.

Basically it can be sort of a money manager as well for for Averaging Down and Averaging up if using fixed size of lots. Not for martigale.

--- 帖子 #1845 ---
Mapi,

For short term trading, have you considered equipping Icarus with a fully adjustable LOT MULTIPLIER progression setting and the Waddah Attar Explosion indicator?

This could be used to capture short, explosive moves as price snaps back towards the trend. A high lot multiplier setting would allow a short, explosive move to be profitable without the need of a larger retracement. Regarding the indicator, perhaps the RSI or Stochastics could do the job, but the Waddah Attar Explosion may be the best fit.

This could also be used to run along side of another Icarus that is using longer, softer settings as a kind of support against a long counter trend move with no retracement.

Umberleigh

--- 帖子 #1846 ---
Yeah, that actually might be it and then they start closing the first order with a loss when they start opening the first order of the 3rd group which adds 0.06 each time and this way they offset the losses for more profits on the last lots and are able to keep the TP very close.

for example;

order 1. - 0.01 lot

order 2. - 0.01 lot

order 3. - 0.01 lot

order 4. - 0.03 lot -> start 0.03

order 5. - 0.06 lot -> +0.03

order 6. - 0.09 lot -> +0.03

order 7. - 0.12 lot -> +0.03

order 8. - 0.15 lot -> +0.03

order 9. - 0.21 lot -> close order 1 then start +0.06 group

There might be a few additions to this like, when they open order 10 which adds 0.06 they'll close order 2 and 3 together to continue.
Hope this can be useful, I think if you can continue the grid for like forever with only taking small losses and the profits making up for when the cycle ends then you'll have something powerful.

Oh and maybe you could add some feature to stop trading after x amount of daily profit.

--- 帖子 #1849 ---
See if below example will better reduce DD. let's say Multiplier=2, Hedging Start Group=2

Group1:  (2 layers)

order 1. - 0.01 lot

order 2. - 0.01 lot

Group2:  (4 layers)                   Hedge Group1: (2 layers)

order 3. - 0.02 lot->                  order 1. - 0.01 lot

order 4. - 0.02 lot ->                 order 2. - 0.01 lot

order 5. - 0.02 lot ->

order 6. - 0.02 lot ->

Group3:  (8 layers)                   Hedge Group 2: (4 layers)

order 7. - 0.04 lot ->                 order 3. - 0.02 lot->

order 8. - 0.04 lot ->                 order 4. - 0.02 lot->

order 9. - 0.04 lot ->                 order 5. - 0.02 lot->

order 10. - 0.04 lot ->               order 6. - 0.02 lot->

order 11. - 0.04 lot ->

order 12. - 0.04 lot ->

order 13. - 0.04 lot ->

order 14. - 0.04 lot ->

--- 帖子 #1850 ---
If the demo account your broker provides to you works as the same as its live account, you can then use the same settings on the live account.  However, you have to very careful of this point, some broker's demo account are different to their live account in leverage, spread, and so on.

--- 帖子 #1851 ---
Although I had mentioned before, it is not a good approach to put a hedging mechanism into Icarus. But it is not to say we cannot code another EA for hedging when needed. The EA is only served as a safe guard of Icarus. One can run the EA when hedging is needed and stop the EA when hedging is no longer needed.

--- 帖子 #1852 ---
I would say it is the right approach and focus should be on its selective use.

--- 帖子 #1857 ---
I am not so sure.  You can test it on the fore test.

I think it is a better way to code a special purpose EA for protecting Icarus by hedging.  The EA is not a grid trading EA, it has its own magic number, but can input the magic number of Icarus.  Then the EA can monitor the performance of Icarus and decide when to put hedging orders (with its magic number) to prevent Icarus from a huge DD.  The EA should also manage two hedging cycles, hedging buys and hedging sells, each orders in the cycle are corresponding to the specific orders they are hedging against.  I think to code such an EA is more easily than to add hedging function into Icarus.

--- 帖子 #1858 ---
This thread is a great read. Just a few general thoughts I had on developing a grid EA that might be useful:

1. Hedging is < some logic that ensures that new long trades are always above prior long trades and new short trades are always below prior short trades and that newer trades are at higher volumes (either greater in number or size). Price always moves somewhere eventually and if you follow this logic eventually your last trade will allow all the underwater trades to resolve, as long as your account doesn't blow up.

2. It doesn't matter how effectively coded your EA is if you overtrade in relation to your margin/account size it will blow up. You'll make more money in the long run by not blowing up.

3. The real holy grail isn't an EA, it's people like @TeChaoLiang who share their knowledge, and code freely. I hope some day I can be as useful. His idea about a 'monitor/overseer' EA is very good.

Good luck, gridders!

--- 帖子 #1859 ---
TeChaoLiang,

A long time ago, 7bit, while developing his snowball EA said the following:

"A combination of grid and anti-grid where the break-even parabola of the anti-grid always lies inside the break-even parabola of the grid and then simply make the ratio of the lot sizes equal to the ratio of the grid widths then this would be the holy grail."

Umberleigh

--- 帖子 #1868 ---
Hi blam,

I load up all charts on sunday night and let the stoch settings take initial trades. If then another signal from channel indi occurs, I check the chart and do some supply/demand out of my stomach ;-) can't really fix this into some rules, price action applies here. See for yourself if you even need those indicators. I use them for alarms on H1 and for entries I will switch to m5 usually.

But I don't load the templates on alarms of the channel-indi / END_OF_TREND indi only, I let them run continuously from sunday on. Until now it has played out very well. So to say I blindly trust the CCFP-Diff level 3+ because from a H1 perspective I personally can't "see" this direction ... but it works ;-)

If you have the three conditions of a chart (up, down, sideways) sortet out in the bigger picture, the entries come naturally, I guess ^^ but yes, deeper pockets for martingale trading can become essential.

CU George

--- 帖子 #1896 ---
Hello.

I would appreciate this too. some thoughts why:

a) all the indicators make the EA really complex and quite difficult to use, also the chance to fall into a "curve fitting mode" is very high, if you know what I mean.

I still use the original version with the hot buttons* (I follow the signals of the market and my stomach  )

b) automated hedging is very dangerous in my eyes, at least for those with not so big pockets

Maybe I am wrong, but with the basic idea which that indicator provides, it becomes a bit safer.

*perhaps useful for some:

if you set the equity warning in the EA to a very small value, the hotbuttons will turn yellow and you will see more support lines. Then you can see exactly where the respective take profit moves when you trigger an order via the yellow buttons. In addition with a good idea where the market could go, I have recently mastered some difficult situations.

--- 帖子 #1905 ---
If the Compound Ratio Moving Average (CoRa_Wave) were to be integrated into Icarus, I believe it would need to be traded "with the trend" as it would average into pullbacks in the main trend, which should keep Icarus quite safe. The precision of CoRa_Wave would not allow Icarus to get caught in a massive move against the trend.

Most probably, I would partner Icarus with a CoRa_Wave EA so that we could ride the trend with CoRa-Wave while Icarus cleans up the pullbacks.

Umberleigh

--- 帖子 #1918 ---
Hi guys, I’ve been a silent reader of this thread since its inception and after backtesting and forward testing Ikarus 2.2 for some months now, after reading and studying this thread completely (twice), I have started making some good profits on a live account (standard 1.500 leverage) .

I would like to share with you some “good practices” I’ve developed for myself in order to profit from this wonderful EA safely. You might find these rules are a little bit extreme, but I consider they are necessary given that this EA is a double-edged sword (extremely profitable but extremely risky too).

Protocol to trade with Ikarus 2.2 (against the trend griding) :

1) Choose the most choppy pairs: given that Ikarus 2.2 is an against the trend grid EA it profits with messy markets. That’s why we want to avoid trending market. CADCHF is the most choppy pair in FX market right now and it’s the one I’m using to trade Ikarus (see weekly chart)

2) Set time limits for EA: you definitely don’t want to let it run free in the markets. I personally trade it the first 7 hours of the market and then I turn it off. You want to reduce market exposure as much as possible. If EA makes some quick profits in the firsts hours of trading, call it a day and turn it off. You should also have a profit target for each day. Of course, while the live account is off, you must run EA on a demo account to keep learning, always watching and learning.

3) Avoid high-impact news: turn it off before any important event, at least half an hour before. Remember: you want to avoid big movements and news-events are the most powerful catalysts. NEVER trade during interest-rate decision days. For more security, just don’t trade if you have important news today.

4) Volume progression should be disabled: in order to trade safely, all trades must be executed with minimum lot size. Needless to say, if you want to survive long term (I mean, years) , you must never, never trade using martingale or the like. Small profits, small risk, keep it boring but safe (there isn’t any other way to trade professionally otherwise it’s betting)

5) Grid size: grid size must increase progressively, the reason being that strong movements are the killer of this the EA so as the market moves in one direction we want the EA to trade less and less until it returns to the mean.

6) Leverage and balance: you definitely need deep balance or high leverage in order to survive losing streaks.

7) Location: the EA profits from choppy markets so we want to start trading near high-traded areas of the price. I personally use POC and Value Area (see market profile studies) or if you want a more simple approach just open the EA near some moving average (not when price is far from it). Studying some “mean reversion” systems might help understand the concept.

8) Take-profits: the EA is not very good taking profits for it doesn’t close extremely profitable trades and it lets them return near it’s entry price until they are closed with the profit-lock function. This is an important weakness. So if some trades are very profitble close them manually and you will make a huge difference at the end of the day.

Hope this helps someone!

--- 帖子 #1941 ---
This thread has been quiet lately with regards to further development. I sense that a lot of us are already profitable with our own settings and adjustments.

Maybe just to keep the fire alive in this thread. I would like to share my expectations whenI set up Icarus for my own use.

I use it on Eurusd only because this is where i am most comfortable with. I studied long trending situations on this pair over the past 3 years.

That is why my 99.9% backtest workflow is based on the last 3 year period.

Using BB as my only trigger,

Using progression - 3 fibonaci

using gs_prog - 0 fixed - this should be carefullly thought of as too small will burn you, too big will give you long drawdowns. (Best to control in ATR)

Using ATR, this is the best kept secret, have the right mix of period, gs_multiplier and tp multiplier for the ATr and you will not have big drawdowns. the small retracements would hit my take profit 85% of the time.

By using ATR: dynamic grid size and dynamic tp is really a game changer. I know a lot has not been using this. But you really have to study this. By having static GS and static TP, you will get burned on contratcting or expanding grid size.

Backtest has to survive for 3 years

Backtest will have static lot size of .01, Scaleability will be easy once we have baseline.

Backtest should not have a maximal drawdown bigger than 90% of my initial fund (margin call protection)

monthly profit %(based on initial fund) should at least be 8% a month.

I do not intervene in times of drawdown, i let the system run.

The screen shot that i posted a few posts up has all passed those conditions and is doing fantastic. Hopefully more forward live trading will solidify my strategy.

So anybody wants to share their workflow?

--- 帖子 #1955 ---
previously, ATR would just compute 1 time and then that is the ATR value and won't change.

Somebody fixed that, and made it constantly change even in the middle of a buy or sell cycle, therefore, making the next trades of the cycle dynamically change the GS_progression and TP because of the ATR. And i have read from Mr. Techaoliang that we need another variable to make it a "Per cycle" rather than a dynamically changing ATR.

I have lived with the dynamic ATR, i think most of the time it works, because if there is a trend mid cycle, the grid automatically expands and therefore expands the gridsize which makes the trades a little farther away.

But i also think having a "per cycle" ATR value can also work for smaller maximum trades.

So were you able to edit Icarus to a "per cycle" ATR?

--- 帖子 #1956 ---
Hi francis79,

Im fully aware of all the discussion before.

What I meant to say was, with version 4.31ATRGridUpdate, the grid is changed when buy==0 OR sell ==0.

So for example a sell postion is open, the grid is changed(while buy is zero), and this shouldnt happen during an existing cycle.

Im still learning Icarus and put most effort in BT and reading code. I dont know if I can do "per cycle" ATR but i will put some effort in it.

--- 帖子 #1984 ---
Hi everyone,

I have just found this thread a few weeks ago and I am now in love with this EA. Thank MaPi and everyone else helps to make it better.

Normally I am almost always a silent reader. But this time I want to be a contributor, to develop it more and find the best strategy with your help.

I am not a coder but have a short knowledge of mql4 so I have made a new version of this EA and share it with you guys.

Icarus V4.75 ThangNguyen

List of changes:

1. Fix Restricted working time function: The last one does not work properly

2. Add EMA Trend Filter: to avoid trading against the trend. EMA trend filter can work with BB, RSI, Stoch, and All.

3. Add an option to continue after risk stop: Normally if account risk < 1, when risk stop happens, the EA will stop. Now I make it only close all losing trades and keep running after that.

4. Add some BB_Mod

Enjoy.

--- 帖子 #1985 ---
Thanks,

Can you explain how to use your EMA Trend filter?

--- 帖子 #1986 ---
Hi Francis79, Here is the code for EMA Trend.

bool EMA_Buy() {

double EMA1 = iMA(Symbol(),EMA_tf,EMA_Period,0,MODE_EMA,PRICE_CLOSE,1);

double EMA2 = iMA(Symbol(),EMA_tf,EMA_Period,0,MODE_EMA,PRICE_CLOSE,2);

double EMA10 = iMA(Symbol(),EMA_tf,EMA_Period,0,MODE_EMA,PRICE_CLOSE,10);

if(EMA1 > EMA2 + EMA_filterlevel* Point && EMA1 > EMA10 + EMA_filterlevel*10* Point) {return(true); }

else {return(false);}

I compare EMA values on bar 1, 2 ,and 10. Buy signal if EMA1 > EMA2 + filter level and EMA1 > EMA10 + filter level x 10.

EMA filter level filter the trendline steepness angle. So the higher the EMA filter level, the stronger the trend is.

EMA10 is used to make sure the trendline steepness is stable for at least 10 bar.

If EMA trend filter is enabled, it will work with each or all other indicators. It does not work alone because it is just a confirmation signal.

If you have any idea to make this EA better, I will see if I can do it (I am not a coder but I will try my best).

I can trigger trading signal base on almost any indicator that draw value to the chart (not if it only show text), with or without sourcecode file.

I can change some of the the EA behaviors but I can not recode the main algorithm because it is too complicate for me.

For everyone: My email: { email address deleted by staff } . Text me if any of you want to. But please don't ask me to do anything just come up in your mind.

I will only consider ideas that I think good. And if you guy find something interesting, please share with me too.

--- 帖子 #1987 ---
After a few weeks of backtesting this EA, I have a thought, Hope you guys can discuss them with me:

Should we NOT use the normal trading entry for this EA. Normal entry with Sl and TP, try to predict future big move. This EA takes advantage of the choppy market. A sudden big move or strong trend against the trade can blow the account in one bar only. Normal entry may help to close a cycle faster most of the time, but also can leave us on the top of the pine tree if it is wrong. I have tried some normal criteria and they make a deeper drawdown.

If not the normal trading entry, what is the criteria best fit for this EA?

Maybe entry point is not the most important thing, risk management is. Grid setting and ATR Multiplier can be savers or killers. What settings you are using?

Is there any idea to make it better in risk management?

Cheers.

--- 帖子 #1988 ---
Hello again guys, I would like to know if someone has ever tried to add a recovery system to the EA, I'm working with one I think it could be interesting.

The idea is that, after X lot/order the EA will try to close the first and last trades in profit, this would help to keep DD lower than now and take advantage some price bounces

I have attached an image so maybe it is easier to see what I mean.

Let's say we decide the recovery system should start after the 3rd opened position, then if the price rolls back enough so the sum of the first and last trades are in profit for a set amount of $ or pips the EA will set an independent SL in profit for those trades, if the price reverse against you, you will get some profit and reduce the risk of the opened trades, the EA will again open new trades if the price keeps going against you, in that case we could decide if the EA keeps adding lots like if nothing happened or if the new trades will take into account there are less lots at risk to set up a new lot volume.

I hope I have explained what I meant, english is not my mother tongue.

Thanks for your time and good luck.

--- 帖子 #1989 ---
In theory, This is what the setting " Hedging Order to balance" does. you can give it a try.

--- 帖子 #1990 ---
Hi ThangNguyen,

I have a slightly different perspective on how your EMA could be used as a component of Icarus. It seems to me that Icarus is a fantastic tool for collecting profits when market action provides frequent pullbacks within ranges or trends. In this environment, we can run Icarus in both directions, all the time, with success. The problem is the potential trend that comes along (rather frequently) without sufficient pullbacks to allow Icarus to close out trades in profit.

What if we use your EMA trend filter to step in around level 4 or 5, trading with the trend, to help close out the group of trades together in a basket. This would allow Icarus to trade all the time in both directions as the market chops around but will be fortified by your EMA trend filter to close out profitably when a trend is established. This way we don't have to wait for a destructive and beastly trend to pullback before we can get out successfully.

Umberleigh

--- 帖子 #1991 ---
Hi Umberleigh,

I understand your opinion but please correct me if I am wrong.

EMA or all other trend indicators calculate trends based on past prices. If you already trade and the new strong trend comes up against you, there is no way to close those trades profitable without sufficient pullbacks. When the first trade against the trend keep losing money and keep opening new order to cover it and lose more, the opposite trades that follow the trend are already close in profit one by one. Nothing there to balance the loss.

The only 2 options here are to enable "Hedge order to balance" or close losing trades to protect the account if the trend is too steep.

Hedge order to balance is an option with a cost of high risk because you will have more big lot trade on the table.

--- 帖子 #1992 ---
Hi ThangNguyen,

Yes, I think you are correct. In my mind, the "with the trend" entries that are based on your EMA would not act exactly as a hedge, but would instead act independently, as it would close the "with the trend" EMA trades based on the EMA readings irrespective of the "counter-trend" losing trades. Any profit earned by the "with the trend" EMA trades would accrue to the TP calculation, thereby allowing the entire group of trades to be closed out quicker.

Umberleigh

--- 帖子 #1993 ---
Do you mean a revenge trade? A revenge trade to cover that loss must be a very big lot. And push the risk further. What if the market turns around right after the revenge trade is open?

I have tried the revenge strategy before, but my experience was not good.

--- 帖子 #1994 ---
If I'm not mistaken Hedging recovery system open oposite trades to the current ones to help to take advantage of the trend and try to close orders with profit, what I was talking about is to use the common pull backs of the trend your trades are in and use them to close the oldest orders so, even in the case you are in a strong trend against your initial trade, you still have the chance to recover, you only need to find a strong enogh pull backs.

I have attached another pick, the green circles are zones where you could close trades with enough profit to compensate some of the losing ones, and the red zone where new trades will be opened again as the price resumes its trend after the pull back, then with those new trades, but with less losing ones to compensate, you have better chances to end the whole cycle with profit

--- 帖子 #1995 ---
I'm not familiar with the "revenge trade". The goal of this "with the trend" trade(s), would simply be to lessen the burden of reaching the TP required to close out the group of trades. The lot size would not have to be equal to the "counter-trend" losing trades. It could be 50% or 25%. Worst case scenario would be that the market turns around before the EMA signals an exit. This would create a manageable loss instead of allowing an account threatening trend to blow up the account.

--- 帖子 #1996 ---
@Leeoo,

Currently, The hedging system opens new big lot trade on both sides at the same time when you reach the max position. Then it tries to thin out the old trade to reduce drawdown while waiting for a big pullback or trend change. because it opens both side trades, I find out sometimes makes it harder to close all losing trades.

About what you talking about trying to close some trade at the pullback, it is what "Thin out the grid" does, right?

I see the problem here is the grid size currently is not based on the pullbacks signal. If we can make it only open the next grid trade on the pullback signal, we will have a better chance to close those trades.

@Umberleigh,
I understand what you mean, but for now, I think if we can change the algorithm of the grid size as I told above to Leeoo, we can have a better chance and less risk.

If we try to do so, how can we identify a potential pullback signal?

What do you guys think?

--- 帖子 #1997 ---
ThangNguyen,

I think that may be a great idea. So let me see if I understand you correctly.

-Enter the first trade via your EMA Trend Filter signal (with the trend).

-Average in with the second trade based on a pullback signal (generated by another indicator)

-This idea would keep us at the point of making each trade useful and relevant instead of just randomly adding new positions based on distance.

-Each "averaging" trade would give us the legitimate chance to ride a pullback to profitability based on a high quality pullback signal.

Is this basically correct?

--- 帖子 #1998 ---
Yes, you get it right Umberleigh.

Changing the second trade position not based on grid size may be too complicated for me. But I will see what I can do. This means we are touching the main algorithm and this one may be no longer a grid EA .

Here I have made an upgrade version for EMA trend. I added Option Mode to it.

Mode - Following: Only open trade with the trend, and the current trend is stronger than the trend filter level.

Mode - Avoid Counter: Allow both directions to trade if the current trend is weaker than the trend filter level. If the current trend becomes stronger than the filter level, the opposite trade won't open.

I also add comments about trend settings to make backtest easier.

While I am forcusing on coding new algorithm changes. you guys can test this version first. Don't forget me if you find something good.

You may need to keep the grid based lot sizing in order to have the fire power to ride the pullback all the way back to profitability.

We'll see.

--- 帖子 #2004 ---
Hi Everyone,
Thanks to all the contributors to this thread. I have been testing the different versions with some success but am still not clear on how the "Take Profit" and "Profit Lock" settings work.
From the original post:
take_profit: Setting for securing profit of the cycle with a trailing stop.
profit_lock: Percentage of profit secured by trailing stop.
I had assumed that "take profit" was the aggregate profit in account currency at which the trailing stop was triggered and "profit lock" was the percentage of that profit that was then locked once triggered.
So, for example, if the settings were 20 and 50% respectively, then when profit for all open orders for that pair hit say $20 and a trailing stop would be started at $10 ($20 x 50%).

However, I have not been able to replicate this in practice.

Also, I am unclear how the trailing stop actually trails the price i.e. trailing step.

Can someone please confirm how these settings work?

Many thanks

--- 帖子 #2008 ---
-Maybe use the EMA Trend filter to select the direction of the initial trade...and keep the first 3 or 4 trades based on grid progression...then bring in the EMA Trend Filter again to handle the 5th, 6th 7th trades...etc., as a featured option. The idea here is to make sure that we are entering these higher level trades at critical points that give us the best chance of exiting the cycle successfully.

-It would be cool to have an option that would allow us to initiate a "pyramiding with the trend" feature (as opposed to "averaging with the trend) to help deal with certain problematic market behavior. This would allow Ikarus to average and pyramid simultaneously.

--- 帖子 #2011 ---
This is a live demo. Over time, more and more I have relied on live demo testing instead of back testing. I have developed many trading strategies in the past that do impossibly well on back test, but reveal their weakness only in live testing. So, I have not completed back testing for this.

This is only one day of live demo testing. Market behavior has been favorable so far. We haven't been challenged by a long, smooth trend yet.

--- 帖子 #2012 ---
That is exactly what I am about to do Umberleigh.

New version 4.79 is here with the custom grid feature.

Custom grid position = 0 : disable

if Custom grid position > 0: From that position, When the price hit the SL line, instead of opening a new average trade immediately, EA starts to consider opening a new average trade base on the same new trade criteria. it means including indicators and EMA trend.

I attached 2 images showing how it works in backtest.

- Without Custom grid, this death trade will blow the account after opening average buy trades on a strong down trend. this trend will keep going down for 1 month before reversing. Only one day, drawdown is 6.6k / 10k.

- With Custom grid set to 4. After opening 3 trades as normal, the EA stops opening new trades on a strong opposite trend. you can see the first death trade was closed in this image with a drawdown of only 2.6k. It takes 27 days to close this trade but it survives.

Something I can not do is change take profit line when using custom grid. because the math to calculate and draw TP and SL line are too complicated for me to touch. But after the backtest, I found it still work as expected. Just ignore the TP line, If you are using custom grid, the EA will close all trades before touching it.

Let's test this version, guys.

--- 帖子 #2013 ---
Hi, Toaster, My new code for working time:

if (Restricted_Working_Time) {

if(weekday >= StartDay && weekday <= StopDay && hour * 3600 + minute * 60 >= StartHour * 3600 + StartMin * 60 && hour * 3600 + minute * 60 <= StopHour * 3600 + StopMin * 60)

{

tradetime = true;

}

else tradetime = false;

}

return(tradetime);

Hope it help.

--- 帖子 #2027 ---
Hi Francis79,

I am using the same version 4.79 to backtest now without a problem. Can you check the backtest journal for any errors?

Do you mean you fail to run the strategy backtest but you still be able to run on the live demo account? what account you are login in MT4 while backtesting the EA. If it is a real account, please try login a demo account.

Your question about using the hedge function and custom grid at the same time: Please skip using the hedge function for now, I am experimenting something new on it because I think it does not do a good job saving the death trade like Umberleigh said. Otherwise, if you are using custom grid, the distance between average trade can spread a lot wider than normal, so the old hedge function no longer can balance and thin out the grid anymore while adding more big lot trades on both side. That is how it blows the account. That is why I plan to change the original hedge function to something else, like a follow trend recover group of trades, triggered by an extremely strong trend like Umberleigh recommended.

The original idea of cutom grid is to survive a medium-long strong smooth trend. The next step is to revive if it won't reverse. It won't be easy for a beginner coder like me (I am a CG artist and I have just learned MQL4 myself for a few months). So please be patient with me

--- 帖子 #2028 ---
Hi,

As I explained when releasing that version, It is based on the same Indicator signal that you set for opening a new first trade.

--- 帖子 #2029 ---
Rob,

Great question. I'm not 100% sure. I believe the signal to trade is determined purely by grid level price action (price movement in a particular direction), then, if you have all indicators set to "true" and any one of the indicators individually set to "true", then the indicator(s) function as a filter, but not technically as an initiator of trades.

Umberleigh

--- 帖子 #2030 ---

Better go with what Thang just said. His mind is deep in the code and understands the coding nuances much better than I do.

Umberleigh

--- 帖子 #2031 ---
It is based on the option " All selected indicators will be applied together" . It is still there before I made new changes.

If it is set to true: open new trade only if all indicators allow.

if it is set to false: open new trade if one of the three allows.

Please note that for now, EMA trend does not work alone, It only works with at least 1 of the three indicators.

--- 帖子 #2032 ---

--- 帖子 #2033 ---
I have been following this thread for a long time. And I wonder all the time. I ask with concern and honestly.

Why are you putting so much energy into nurturing bad entrances and recover them?

Wouldn't it be better to charge this energy into the invention

a) How to quickly discover and exit a bad entrance

b) how to nurture and accumulate good inputs

While you are trying to save a bad entry, your equity is blocked and you are losing many other good entries during "recovery" time.

IMHO

1. constantly monitoring and then reacting to whether our position is "close" to the market. If it is not, you have to run away

2. have a large free equity, so that there is enough space to be not "close" to the market.

In other words: optimizing exposure against expected ROI and known trading system performance (profit ratio, win/ratio, drawdowns, sharpe ratio)

3. have a diversified portfolio for risk mitigation

these are just my thoughts  the same intellectual energy can be devoted to this approach.

--- 帖子 #2034 ---
I think the answer lies with the idea that we cannot predict the future with any certainty. Bad entries or good inputs have no real meaning when a market can and will change direction on you in an instant...and apparently for no reason.

We do have access to hundreds of EA's that purport to do exactly as you suggest. Many of these EA's can do well when operating in a specifically favorable market environment. Unfortunately, these same EA's perform poorly in unfavorable conditions.

So, really we are just exploring a different approach to see what can be done. Personally, I am exploring many other areas of trading. Perhaps a combination of differing tools and methods will find a successful outcome.

Umberleigh

--- 帖子 #2050 ---
Thank you Kofix11. I agree that a properly selected combination of EA's can be set and synchronized well enough to perform well.

Way back when you joined Forex Factory, there were some giants here. Over the last 6 months, I have enjoyed studying the threads created by Nanningbob, Hanover, 7bit, Old Dog and others. These guys were very thorough and had an intellectual, theoretical approach that was very appealing and thought provoking. I think I kept going because these guys inspired my interest. Regarding Icarus, I would say that something 7bit said regarding grids/averaging/pyramiding really stuck with me:

"A combination of grid and anti-grid where the break-even parabola of the anti-grid always lies inside the break-even parabola of the grid and then simply make the ratio of the lot sizes equal to the ratio of the grid widths then this would be the holy grail."

Umberleigh

--- 帖子 #2051 ---

--- 帖子 #2052 ---

--- 帖子 #2053 ---
When using martingale with a low multiplier, you can soften the GS_progression, softer than fibonaccis GS_progression, I just want Gridsize to gradually increase, rather than double up(on martingale) while fibonacci grid size can sometimes over do the later sizing of grid.

Maybe depends on how you strategize using the settings available. But standard fib or matingale lot progression does not work for me. My main strategy is keep the TP close as possible to the latest trades, so that a little pullback will always hit the TP. That's why i use fixed grid size, and let atr expand or contract the grid freely.

--- 帖子 #2054 ---
Yes, I understand. I use "progression" setting #1 (d'Alembert) which progresses 1,2,3,4...etc. I plan on experimenting with the different "grid progressions" now.

Thanks for clearing that up for me.

--- 帖子 #2087 ---
1. source code #047: panel combined with buy/sell status, on the right hand side.

Request =

1.1 can split (similar to version 4.72) buy/sell to left side on the chart?

1.2 I prefer colFontWhite for the buy/sell context. easier to read in white color.

2. Elaborate of EA inputs (With sample / dummy proof remarks).

Note: Maybe someone, can help outline / summarize the EA's user manual (sort of)

extern double grid_size       = 20;       // Grid_Size (orders' distance)

extern int gs_progression     = 3;        // Grid_Step Mode (0=fixed. 1=sum. 2=martingale. 3=fibonacci)

extern double gs_multiplicator  =3;       // Martingale coefficient for grid step

extern double take_profit     = 20;       // Take_Profit.

extern double profit_lock     = 0.80;     // Profit_Lock

extern double min_lots        = 0.01;     // Min_lots

extern double equity_warning  = 0.20;     // Equity_Warning (0.2=20%)

extern double account_risk    = 1.00;     // Account_Risk (1=1%)

extern bool useTradeCycleRisk = false;    // Use Buy OR Sell Cycle Risk

extern double cycleEquityRisk = 0.10;     // Buy OR Sell Cycle Equity Risk Percentage (0.1=10%)

extern int progression        = 3;        // Lot size Mode (0=fixed. 1=sum. 2=martingale. 3=fibonacci)

extern double lot_multiplicator =1.0;     // Martingale coefficient for lot

extern int max_positions      = 6;        // Max_Position

extern int max_spread         = 100;      // Max_Spread

extern int show_forecast      = 1;        // Show_Forecast

extern int profit_chasing     = 0;        // number of min_lots for chasing profit

extern bool both_cycle        = true;     // Initiate Both Cycle when indicators is used

extern bool hedging_active    = false;    // Hedging Order to balance is used

extern int grid_partially_close = 4;      // Grid partial close ( >4 trades close last & 1st trade in profit)

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

May I ask question for below outline items.

2.1 take profit. Meaning by Pip / point?

2.2 profit lock. Meaning by %?

2.3 "int progression        = 3;" Referring to Lot size?

2.4 show_forecast. Meaning by?

2.5 profit_chasing. Example to elaborate?

--- 帖子 #2112 ---
I quickly wanted to describe my GBPUSD insights a little bit, it might be useful for somebody  because you'll get the connection why I use Icarus for it.

All statements are just my personal opinion and there is never any warranty whatsoever. Market is unpredictable, at times.

GBPUSD has levels. I call them my "quarters". For example (1.22 can be replaced with ANY leading number)

1.22 00 with mostly 10p overshoot e.g. 1.2190 / 1.2210

1.21 75 with a lingering range of 1.2170 / 1.2180 (so this is +- 5p as an in between level)

1.21 50 half a 100p run level - 1.2140 / 1.2160 (10p again here)

1.21 25 in between quarter - levels around 1.2120 / 1.2130

1.21 00 "big zero" number - rinse and repeat like 1.2200 here +-10p

These are my personal observations. So, IF it decides to move, it is very rarely that it moves LESS than a quarter.

So, grab a demo, look at it, go for it.

I use Icarus for adding trades at those levels if needed. Yes I use martingale style - hey this is the Icarus thread ^^ I use a 100p SL each level of a trade.

It would be utterly GREAT if we'd have a SL for each level in Icarus ...

Happy trading to all of you. I hope this might help somebody in the way one can see the market.

Gonna be on a motorbike tour next week and will be back 11th July+.

CU around ! George

I am also not a coder, so I rely on the contributors who code, and use what is available here to be able to create a useable bot for my own trading.

--- 帖子 #2130 ---
Account_Risk (1=1%) dosen't control lot sizing.

When 100 - (100 * account_risk)) / 100) * AccountBalance() > AccountEquity() - it "pushes" the StopAll button (function).

Fx. set to 1 : 100 - (100 * 1) / 100 * AccountBalance() = 0, meaning dosen't ever trigger any stopall.

--- 帖子 #2133 ---
// Account_Risk (1=1%). Stop Loss on account base, when reached all orders will be closed an EA will stop trading.

// Profit_Lock. Percentage of profit secured by trailing stop.

hedging. // Hedging Order to balance is used (When or how algorithm)

// Account_Risk. Stop Loss on account base, when reached all orders will be closed an EA will stop trading. (So far not yet happen)

//profit_chasing     = 0;        // number of min_lots for chasing profit

--- 帖子 #2149 ---
EA assigns SL, TP to pending orders and market orders. The bug is that it assigns a meaningless PT value to pending commands. When the market changes the pending order to a market order, the EA continues correctly.

--- 帖子 #2153 ---
Hello folks,

I have decided to share my work with everyone here as a token of appreciation to everything these threads have been teaching me. I took on the challenge of converting Ikarus_4.73 to an mq5 version. Reason being, I believe its easier to optimize, and test with more reliable data, using the MT5 database. Nevertheless, I probably will not update further as I am working on other projects, and this was simply a learning opportunity I wanted to challenge myself with. I used the version found through fraggli's github link. I didn't test on demo or live, but ran it a few times on tester and seems to work as intended. Hope this helps someone out there. Again, all credit goes to everyone who helped develop this EA up to this point, I simply converted it.

Good luck to everyone!

--- 帖子 #2154 ---

[quote=DavidRol2o;14081778]Hola amigos, he decidido compartir mi trabajo con todos aquí como muestra de agradecimiento por todo lo que estos hilos me han estado enseñando. Asumí el desafío de convertir Ikarus_4.73a una versión mq5. La razón es que creo que es más fácil de optimizar y probar con datos más confiables usando la base de datos MT5. Sin embargo, probablemente no actualizaré más ya que estoy trabajando en otros proyectos, y esta fue simplemente una oportunidad de aprendizaje con la que quería desafiarme. Usé la versión que encontré a través del enlace github de fraggli. No probé en la demostración o en vivo, pero lo ejecuté varias veces en el probador y parece funcionar según lo previsto. --- 帖子 #2188 ---
Hi,

First of all, thanks to everybody doing the coding and providing this tool and its steady improvements to all the fellow traders for free, really appreciate that!

I started fiddling with this last week and can already tell that there's some great pontential for me in this ea, the only thing I noticed are the account-meltdowns when in backtesting-mode, because the account-protection measures don't seem to apply when running historical data.

Would it be somehow possible to  add a "hard stop loss" that is dependent on the total sum of all open positions ("P/L Sym." in the tool) and automatically closes all positions when a certain negative amount is reached?

Sometimes a very profitable setting shredds the account due to a single big move blowing the chart out of the grid (I'm experimenting with a scalping setup on low timeframes, so the grid and take profit are rather tight), and such a set stop would mean just a little dent in the backtesting-graph instead of a full blown account, thus making backtesting for us easier.

I added the version I'm currently using in the attachement just for reference, thanks!
