--- 帖子 #2210 ---
Guys,

Be very, very careful with Ikarus. It is true that it can generate massive profits in favorable market conditions. However, the same power that creates can and will take away.

At the end of the day, it all comes down to one measurement...how many pips can the market move in one direction without a pullback of (X) pips, before your account blows up?

I think Ikarus is only half of the puzzle. The other half is most probably some form of pyramiding operation (with the trend) that synchronizes with and contributes to Ikarus' TP calculation. It doesn't have to be perfect or precise, but it needs to be there...adding positions with the trend when Ikarus is averaging in deep and possibly getting into existential trouble.

--- 帖子 #2211 ---
Hi, im a long time lurker here but i have never posted anything (because i feel i dont bring value to the community: most of the people here either are profitable, have a long career or a master coders) and i admire the work that you all have been doing on Ikarus (i cannot code in MQL but i do hire coders every now and them to test theories). I strongly agree with this view Umberleigh, what i have found while exploring it is that both things needs to happen within the same EA or at least controlled by another EA that can sync them and im not sure how to deal with the fact that the pyramid one will eventually get either too big on trade size or have the levels too spaced out to get proper gains while trending (without even take into consideration the amount of trades that will be stopped out despite being in the correct direction  due to SL being hit). I have tried only pyramiding alone but i haven't been able to couple those two concepts of the pyramid and Ikarus working together.. Any clue on that?

Regards,

S

--- 帖子 #2212 ---
Inserted Video

The cartoon is called "Icarus and the Wise Men" (1976).

Text:

Once upon a time there lived an eccentric named Icarus. All his neighbors, smart people, have already found their calling in life.

And, now, they devoted their leisure time to philosophical conversations about the meaning of being, and so on ...

And this one... was a eccentric.

Seeing Icarus falling, smart people thought, and one of them, the smartest, said: "Quod licet Jovi, non licet bovi" (What is allowed to Jupiter is not allowed to the bull). Thus was born the first indisputable truth.

Pes sic tendatur ne lodix protereatur (Stretch your legs along the clothes). Thus was born the second truth!

Festina lente - You go quieter - you will continue.

Est avis in dextra (melior quam quattuor extra) - Better a titmouse in the hand than a distant crane.

Ne sutor supra crepidam (judicet) - Every cricket know your hearth.

Via trita via tuta - The beaten path is safe (You can’t jump above your head).

Quo altior grapus tanto profundior casus - The higher you climb, the deeper you fall.

Bene qui stat non moveatur - Whoever stands well does not need to move (inscription on the monument to Icarus)

And, nevertheless, Icarus will fly!!!

--- 帖子 #2213 ---
gpsamj,

Ikarus does a very good job of executing its core task (averaging grid). Perhaps the obstacle lies not with Ikarus but with the instrument(s) we are trading. We have established that Ikarus will blow up if it encounters a long, smooth trend without a reasonable pullback.

Why not use Ikarus to trade an instrument(s) that does not trend? In other words, trade an instrument that "ranges only".

This theoretically can be done by trading the "cointegrated spread" of two or more currency pairs.

I believe this idea would be complicated to code... so a master coder would be needed. The "hedge ratio" of each pair would need to be locked so that the integrity of the cointegrated relationship is maintained.

--- 帖子 #2214 ---
At the end of the cartoon, the little boy took the feathers of Icarus (https://www.forexfactory.com/thread/...5#post14182195).

In 2012, at a Russian forum, the fourteen-year-old genius Connect495 took on the challenge of safely trading a grid of stop and limit orders.

And he promised to share the result of his work. But a large number of "wise men" poured a lot of verbal crap on him.

Connect solved the problem and showed how the Expert Advisor works. Partially told how he solved the problem.

And then he disappeared from the forum forever.

On the screen, the work of EA for 5 days from a deposit of $ 10,000.
Attached Image (click to enlarge)

For years, his fans have been trying to solve this problem again. This year, one trader said that he succeeded and showed several videos of work using the Connect method.
Inserted Video

EA trades a mixed grid of limit and stop orders.

--- 帖子 #2220 ---
Hi folks,

after a long time I am visiting my own thread  Thank you all for your ideas, works and thoughts on Icarus. As you might have seen from my linked live account I am on an all time high, also I have hit the Top20 of real accounts here in ForexFactory. Atm I am trading mainly EURUSD short (in direction of trend and swap) and US500 on future base (so it is swap free for me), I stoped trading USDJPY and all JPY crosses due to the intervention of BoJ.

Sometime I received mails here asking wich settings I am using. Since more than 6 months (where my account was liquidated twice within one wekk in the same market) I stoped starting cycles by settings, but do this manual via hot buttons. I use my knowledge, the chart, also CurrencyStrengthMeters when it comes to forexpairs, I am super aware of swap when choosing a market (check the stats of my real account, after all lots traded I still have earned some money from swaps).

After I have opend a cycle manualy I allow the EA to handel the cycle, sometimes I change settings for TP in favour on my analysis of the market. For EURUSD I am running the system with Grid_Size=50,GS=3,TP=150, PL:0,89,MinLot 0,1 and Progression= 3, allowing 5 Positions to be opend, latest than I take over by myself via hot buttons.

It might be I need to stop trading for this year soon, due to the fact I have a stupid tax law in my country, allowing me only to make 20K losses a year, so when there are bigger losses I do have to pay taxes on the wins but I cannot use losses above that boarder for summing them up against the wins. Currently I can make another 684,- € loss this year, lol...

I wish you all green pips,

Cheeeeers, MaPi

--- 帖子 #2238 ---
dear mapi,

thank you for your response, here i explained more,

sorry about my English

Here are several point that i mentioned before about adding option to icarus/ikarus:

- turn off the grid logic, as a main trigger (un-grid).

so it would be more flexible and could choose which will be the main trigger plus one or two indicators as confirmation trigger. to more secure the set of entries.

i've already tried backtesting icarus the latest version 4.7x, 5 years backward from 2023 using 15M and 1H.

the problem always persist even other trigger indicator already set off. when the market anomali happened it always blown the account.

- daily start/off trade hour,

icarus version that i used parameter is when i choose Monday at 1.00 to start trade and end trade 16.00 on Thursday. it mean ikarus will be start from 1.00 Monday until 16.00 thursday.

some of us like to trade in less volatile market such asia market time only and not the whole hours.

for example :

I used momentum based logic that run automatically on asian market. i usually use 0-12 GMT. The rest hour until 24 for completing the set of floating trade.

i choose this set and configuration with ease in mind (and also already backtest it backward 5 or more years).so I'm not felt the urge of always need to look on VPS or the auto trade logic in real account, just to see, how it is perform, or it already blown out.

Just when i spare, check the news and monitored market with high volatility like london & newyork.

and sometimes i tried to manually enter.

- Manual Support Handle Setting,

i know icarus could handle manual entry by clicking the button buy/sell. but i don't know if it could handle manual pending order that entered manually without

using buy/sell button. i haven't tried this. but maybe if possible to add : manual trade handle/support manual trade.

- add another indicator trigger, such a leading indicator :

> divergence (I used macd divergence, but as I knew, oscillator divergence like stoch, rsi, cci and others could do also), there is a potential of reversal with leading indicator.

> td sequential, this sequential is also a leading indicator for a potential reverse.

> Volume indicator is good indicator for predict a reversal or continuity. i learn this in Volume Spread Analysis, using H4 TF. is there a reversal or continuation.

FYI:

I used momentum indicator I used this indicator as a main for catch reversal of trend, combine with macd and S/R Lines, Tick Volume and TD Seq.

- add hard stop loss according to DD%. and stop trade, until it manually turn on.

with assumption harmoni of logic is not good with market condition today.

and maybe for the option of un-grid based I wonder if it could discussed on the forum? thank you in advance for the great idea of the logic.

I know theres is setting for hardstop based on equity draw down. but i could make it work, always blown on backtest. maybe i miss something here.

Rgds,

P.S :

some people said:

it's not about how big profit that we could make,

but it is all about how long we could survive in the market.

--- 帖子 #2242 ---
Hi, I have spend some time with a coder ans another trader to implement a new hedging mode. We did not finish and stopped the project.

Out of practice I have some new ideas here, but so far I just use them manually (I am not a coder). Hedging with Icarus is for my understanding not aiming on maximal protection, but on getting the possibility to survive more pips against us!

--- 帖子 #2243 ---
As I had mentioned before, I don't think it is a right approach to implement a hedging function into Icarus, because hedging function violate the against trend grid trading logic.  However, it is not to say we cannot code another EA that serve as a watch guard of Icarus.  When necessary, the EA can do hedging to protect the account, and handles the hedging pairs separtely.

--- 帖子 #2244 ---
can you share your settings and currency?  Thank you

--- 帖子 #2245 ---
Hi, hope you are doing fine. To prevent missunderstanding, I am not talking about heding in a classic way. The logic I am using is to close the last order of the loosing cycle, when there is a profit on, and using part of this profit to close the first orders or to reduce their volume, so market can go more agains us without causing a liquidation. If you are interested in this approach I can go into details, cheers!

--- 帖子 #2247 ---
Hi, Trailing happens in the EA, not at the broker, so it should not be a problem. May I give you with 20 years of professionelle experience in the CFD&FX industry one advise? Even if the trailing SL is handeld on the EA side, for the case your broker is not allowing you to trail on every single tick (e.g. in setting a minimum distance for a SL) find a better broker who does not do so, cheeeeeeerrrsss

--- 帖子 #2253 ---
I'm fine, thank you.

As you mentioned, a classic way of hedging is not suitable for a grid trading EA. I think your logic dealing with hedging could be a good approach.

Hedging must has its purpose. Eventually, the hedged pairs have to be nicely released and turning loss to be profit. To hedge is simple, however, to release hedged pair nicely is sophistic. We have to find a right timing to release the hedged pair, not too early and not too late.

--- 帖子 #2254 ---
Is there some one can? order to make some ea, which includes time-based order closing function? this is posible?

--- 帖子 #2255 ---
use this for mql5, posTime is your time to close:

PositionSelectByTicket(ticket);

if ( (long)TimeCurrent() - PositionGetInteger(POSITION_TIME) > posTime) {

trade.PositionClose(ticket,);

}

--- 帖子 #2322 ---
Hello to all you "gridders" out there...

I have tried Ikarus_4.75___flexATR_May_2023 and found out that the CCI indicator didn't work at all. So I've fixed it with the help of AI coding... and now it works.

Also I have made a bunch of visual changes to make the entire chart more user friendly and easier to read. I've tried to display closed profits as text labels in $/pips on the chart above the candles like in the "AW Recovery / AW Trend Predictor" or "EA Black Dragon" but I have failed to do so. Maybe a very good coder can do it?

This version uses the Stochastic, RSI and CCI by default together with the flexible ATR grid size, calculating the last 120 bars (on H1 charts that would be 1 week), so the grid size and grid profit should adapt to almost all currency pairs automatically, without need to change the pips each time.

The overbought/oversold levels are quite strict, so Ikarus will make less trades. But hey, less is often more, right? Give it a go...

Update 07/11/2023: I've found 3 minor bugs and corrected them + some visual improvements. Please download again.

--- 帖子 #2343 ---
You have 3 options with the hot buttons.

Post#1

The EA has some hot buttons so you can manage the action with one click:
Stop Next Cycle: After a cycle is closed in profit the new cycle will not be started. Rest & Realize: The EA will not add any new positions, when the take profit is reached it will use the trailing stop to secure and realize the cycle profit Stop & Close: All positions will be closed immediately, and the EA will not open new cycles

When a cycle has reached the number of positions you set in max_possition the manual mode hot buttons will be activated (Buttons will show yellow colour, Yellow Alert). The modus is also activated when equity drawdown is higher than the setting under equity_warning (Buttons will show red colour, Red Alert).

--- 帖子 #2357 ---
Hello dear gridders!

I'm very excited to share with you the new, completely re-written 2024 version of Ikarus, which changed so much, so that I have renamed it to "FLEXY THE DRAGON" if you don't mind, as I didn't like the name so much...  Before you throw eggs on me... hold your horses, as this version is able to... are you ready for this?

Yes, it's able to trade almost EVERY INDICATOR (with buffers). And not just one, up to 3 additional indicators, also in combination with the Bollinger, RSI, Stoch, CCI. And that's not all. You can also use now the option "strict signals" to open new grids only, if there is a valid signal. And if that's not enough, it's also able to use any indicator as exit trigger, which will close the entire grid.

It also displays now the profits directly on the chart, in green color for positive winners and red color for negative loosers. If there is more than one trade closed, it also displays how many orders where closed at the same time (in brackets). This was one of the hardest part to figure out how to code...

I have also completely re-ordered and described the settings to make it more userfriendly and understandable. At the same time I've tried to keep the names of the old settings, so we know what we are talking about. There is also a mini-guide under the custom indicator settings, which explains how to set up the indicators (as there are different types of indicators out there).

Yes, I know this should be actually not for free... This could cost easy $499... but hey, I've just modified it and I could never code the entire EA, as I don't really know how to code. It took quite a few weeks to do this with the help of different AI tools. If you like to support me, feel free to do so, but of course only if you have earned some money with it!

ATTENTION: There is just one minor bug, which I couldn't fix on my own and that's the auto lot size. If you use auto lot size (true), then as soon as you use any kind of stop loss and it gets triggered, there will be an error in the journal and it will not open any more trades. If someone could have a look into it, that would be awesome. I think it has something to do with the calculation based on the last balance/equity. For now leave it to "false" and adjust the lot size manually.

And one more tipp: If you want to backtest faster, turn off all three "show..." options in the beginning (on top) of the settings.

Anyhow I wish everyone lots of fun with this new tool and feel free to share any of your favourite set files and indicator setups for Flexy The Dragon v2...

Greetings, Daniel

--- 帖子 #2362 ---
Hi Gridders,

I'm still experimenting with the PTL "Perfect Trend Line" indicator by Mladen / Mrtools, as this is almost the same like the "Point Zero Day Trading" or the "Donchian Breakout" indicator, but it's for free and is very lightweight:
https://forex-station.com/attach/file/3425793

This is also a good example for the "Empty" and "Price" type indicator settings with its buffers:

For your base/main trend line you can try a PTL-120/240/480 (=1/2/4 weeks) as "Price" type indicator with buffers "0" for buy/sell, as this is just using the line of the PTL indicator. This will represent the weekly/monthly trend. And for the entry you can use the arrows of the same indicator, but as a PTL-3 (period 3) as "Empty" type indicator with buffer "5" for buy and "4" for sell. That's working like a breakout following the high/lows of the last 3 candles on the H1 chart.

In this way it will place new orders each time the price starts to trend again in the main direction. So it's not always trading, it leaves room for the price to retrace and then enters on those short 3 candle breakouts.

For the grid spacing you can try 20-40 pips with max. 10 orders and take profit of 10-20 pips with partical closing 2 (close the grid as soon as possible using the last order's profit to close the oldest orders) and with a lot multiplier 1.5.

That's right. Always make backtests in the strategy tester (control points and every tick) and also on a demo account to make sure everything works 100% before you touch any of your real money to trade with!

If you turn all indicators off, then the EA will place trades without any indicators all the time. So you might use for example the Bollinger Bands indicator and set the deviaton to 99 or sth similar, so the EA won't place any trades automatically. Just try it on demo and see if that works.

Greetings,

Daniel

--- 帖子 #2365 ---
Here you go. Just change the 240 number to whatever you like, put it in your indicator folder and then write "PTL-240" in your custom indicator. If it's in a folder, for example "Trends", you need to write "Trends/PTL-240" into the indicator name. Choose the indicator type "Empty" (for using only the arrows) or "Price" (for using the trend line) and then keep the buffers at 0/0 for the Price or change to 5/4 for Empty. Change the "Exit" to false otherwise it will close the entire grid, even if it's not in profit.

Did you read the mini guide under the custom indicator settings? Empty is for arrow type of indicators, Value is for oscillators, Price is for trend lines (like moving averages) and Cross is the same, but it triggers only once, if price crosses the line.

Wow, this should be really not for free... lol, now I'm even doing here customer support...

Greetings,

Daniel

--- 帖子 #2370 ---
Hello Gridders,

I have built yet another new exciting feature into Flexy v2.1: It's called "Profit Reducing" which will reduce the take profit per X pips for each opened grid order.

So if let's say your take profit is set to 20.0 pips and your profit reducing is set to 2.0 pips, then after 5 orders your take profit will be just 10.0 pips... and after 10 orders (or more) it will be set to the minimum value of 1.0 pip.

This will close (loosing) grids in strong trends against the grid much faster, as only a short retracement is needed to close all orders. I've found this feature in the CAP Strategy Builder as well as in the AW Scalping Dynamics, which worked quite well with gridding.

So instead of increasing your lot multiplier to 2.0 with very high risk, now you can try the "Profit Reducing" feature to close grids faster, with significantly less risk.

--- 帖子 #2380 ---
Hi Ron,

I'm not sure what do you mean by "the broker won't like this". Could you explain further why the brokers would not allow grid trading?

Of course, if you have trades every minute or a trailing stop with a 1 point step... I understand. But if you trade for example on H1 charts and add max. every hour one more trade to your maximum 12 trades limited grid, I'm sure this would be no problem for the broker.

If you're going crazy with grid trading on M5 charts without any strategy/indicators and make your grid spacing 2pips tiny, I'm sure the broker would contact you sooner or later...

I think the main problem is to handle the big drawdowns caused by the grids, that's why we have to find ways to limit our risk by closing the grids asap. This could be done with "Partial Closing" where a retracement will be taken advantage of by closing the 1st and last grid orders. Now there is also the option of "Profit Reducing", which will also close the grid earlier by decreasing your initial take profit if more orders are opened.

I highly recommend to trade always with the main trend (200MA). To do so, you can use the Bollinger Bands with a 200 period (SMA) and 0.1 deviation. Then choose your favourite entry/trigger indicator... Maybe the inbuild RSI with a period of 3 and 90/10 ob/os levels? Or a donchian breakout (PTL) with a period of 3, 6, or 12? Just some ideas...

Happy trading,

Daniel

--- 帖子 #2382 ---
Alright, enjoy. Here is another indicator, which might be useful for someone. It's called "Bollinger Backs 2.0" and draws arrows if the price breaks out of the bands and goes back again, so it will wait until price goes inside the bands. Simply change the deviation inside the mq4 file. The buffers for the arrows are 3 and 4.

Try a combination with the inbuild Bollinger Bands, 200 period + 0.1 deviation. This will keep you always going WITH the trend. So a buy signal would be triggered, if price is below the BB200(0.1) and breaks out of the upper band of the smaller Bollinger Backs 2.0 and goes back again - if that makes sense?

You can also try "Exit other open orders" on opposite signal of the Bollinger Backs (as a stop loss). But always remember to turn off auto lot size, because after the exit it won't open anymore trades. So set your base lot size manually.

Greetings,

Daniel

--- 帖子 #2383 ---
Here is a good example of exiting on the opposite of the Bollinger Backs signal.

1) The price was still below the BB200(0.1) and broke out of the BB20(2.0) and went back, so it opened the inital trade.

2-7) More grid orders were opened...

8) Price retraced only a bit, so the 7th order was closed, together with the 1st order ("Partial Closing" to reduce the amount of grid orders).

9) It opened the same 7th order with same lot size again, waiting to close the 2nd order or hitting take profit line...

10) But it couldn't either, so the opposite blue arrow of the BB20(2.0) triggered an exit of the entire sell grid

Greetings,

Daniel

--- 帖子 #2387 ---
Hi Mr. Mapi and fellow traders.

I just registered this account to share my experience with ikarus2.2. I had tremendous success since Oct 2023. I have been to double the account in a month on average. I always start with an 10000$ demo account and turn it to 20000$ in about a month and i would get a new demo account with 10000. I trade most of the pairs. With some pairs like EURAUD, EURNZD, GBPAUD GBPNZD GBPCAD I use larger grid size than others. I don't blindly turn on ikarus and let it trade. I use extreme TMA system to decide whether i should go short, long or both. This way i don't get caught by a big move against me.  Especially if the price is in the middle of the band, I double the regular grid size i usually use for that pair.

I recently set up a live account and started trading. With the demo account when the EA opens both long and short at the same time, it's market natural so there is no risk, but it does come with the cost of spread and overnight fees. So I would like to start the EA with a small size let's say 0.01lot to start, and once it starts I would like to change the trading size to something bigger let's say 0.1 hoping that when the market goes against me ikarus would add 0.1lot instead of 0.01. But it seems not working. Even though i changed the setting min_lot to 0.1 lot after it opened 0.01lot, when the time comes it still adds 0.01. Do someone know how to solve this problem? Basically i wanted to initiate small like a bait and change the size bigger which is the real size i want to use. If the current EA doesn't have the functionality, can someone help to add it? I highly appreciate it. Thank you!

--- 帖子 #2389 ---
there is no fixed settings for grid step. For less volatile pairs i usually 60 to start and can go up to 100 if it's in the middle of the band. For more volatile ones i start with 100 and can go up to 200. If you are hoping to make money with a fixed setting, most likely you will lose. The market is moving, hence the settings need to change.

--- 帖子 #2390 ---
ikarus2.2 manages trades with the magic number.

when you want to trade a bigger lot size like 0.1 lot you can so use market order manually with a different magic number ....

or you can load ikarus2.2 on another chart with a different magic number from that using 0.01lot.

it will come a time when you have to close all the positions with 0.01lot and maybe take some small  losses and let those with 0.1lot run.

...

--- 帖子 #2391 ---
to use dynamic settings according to the prevailing market type conditions is always better

ikarus2.2 work best when the market is sideways choppy and is range bound.

when the market starts to trend, then the traders must decide to trade only in one direction.

--- 帖子 #2394 ---
double equityDifference = max_equity - AccountEquity();

if (max_equity != 0) {

double equityPercentage = equityDifference / max_equity * 100;

string panelText1 = "DD: -" + DoubleToString(equityDifference, 2) + " " + ter_currencySymbol + " (-" + DoubleToString(equityPercentage, 2) + " %)";

Write("panel_1_10", panelText1, 5, 190, "Roboto Condensed", 14, clrGold);

string panelText2 = "Max: " + DoubleToString(max_float, 2) + " " + ter_currencySymbol + " (" + DoubleToString(max_float / max_equity * 100, 2) + " %)";

Write("panel_1_11", panelText2, 5, 213, "Roboto Condensed", 11, clrDarkGoldenrod);

} else {

string panelText1 = "DD: -" + DoubleToString(equityDifference, 2) + " " + ter_currencySymbol + " (-100.00 %)";

Write("panel_1_10", panelText1, 5, 190, "Roboto Condensed", 14, clrGold);

string panelText2 = "Max: " + DoubleToString(max_float, 2) + " " + ter_currencySymbol + " (100.00 %)";

Write("panel_1_11", panelText2, 5, 213, "Roboto Condensed", 11, clrDarkGoldenrod);

}

--- 帖子 #2396 ---
The main question is how offen you can interfere with Icarus. If you put Lot multiplicator ot 10 next position will be 0.1 as you wish but the next one is 1 lot.

In case that you can access Icarus between opening possitions of 0.1 and 1 lot you will have to return Lot multiplicator to 1 and to close possitions of 0.01 lot (Icarus based on number of opened possitions and the smallest one choose next lot size).

Or to define new lot progression algorithm...

--- 帖子 #2398 ---
Newer versions of EA have that parameter.

--- 帖子 #2399 ---
hi Mpele. I would love set limit orders. do you mean if magic number is 0, ikrus will not open trades right away? and how does ikrus recognize my limit order if i put it manually? Or is there a way to put limit order through ikrus? What's version has this functionality? Thank you very much!

--- 帖子 #2400 ---
Icarus take in consideration for its math all opened positions of current symbol and defined magic number. When you set limit order, from the moment it has been triggered, if it has right magic number Icarus will treat it as it's own.

So, as the magic number of manually orders is 0 you need to set Icarus to work with 0 and you can manually add orders (first or later) and it will do the rest.

If you have orders outside of Icarus you need very simple script to just set limit order with right magic number.

--- 帖子 #2401 ---

--- 帖子 #2402 ---
There is no downside if you do not have other independent manually opened position.

--- 帖子 #2411 ---
Hello, the indi Bollinger Backs uses arrows, so the buffers are empty as long as there is no arrows plotted on the chart. Therefore select empty type and buffers for arrows will be 3 for buy, 4 for sell. Value is only for oscillators with values like RSI2 with value of 80 or 20 etc. Greetings, Daniel

Hello, just try it out. Option 2 means it will use the multiplier. There is no input option to use custom lot sizes. It will simply multiply it by 1.1, 1.3, 1.45, 1.7 or whatever you like...

--- 帖子 #2419 ---
Default is 1.0, but it says 0.01 = 1%, I assume this is based on you setting your grid position size to 0.01? so if you had 0.5 position size that would = 1%

So 1.0 is always 1% right?

--- 帖子 #2420 ---
1.0=100%，That is, no profit lock-in.    0.5 is to lock in half of the profit, and 100pips to lock in 50pips profit. Close the position when the floating profit is less than 50pips

Here is yet another updated version v2.4 as I've fixed the bug and added two new features.

Now it displays the ADR10 in the top right corner, just under the currency symbol, as I'm using the ADR a lot.

I have also re-arranged the buttons into a simple one line panel, added a bit of spacing in between to create 3 groups and gave the buys a blue-ish and sells a red-ish color instead of the weird green-ish color. The other 3 stop and realize buttons are now in a gray-ish color.

This makes it hopefully easier to spot and will avoid human errors. In case of a yellow or red alert, the buttons still become all yellow and red.

--- 帖子 #2427 ---
fix by code :

double equityDifference = max_equity - AccountEquity();

if (max_equity != 0) {

double equityPercentage = equityDifference / max_equity * 100;

string panelText1 = "DD: -" + DoubleToString(equityDifference, 2) + " " + ter_currencySymbol + " (-" + DoubleToString(equityPercentage, 2) + " %)";

Write("panel_1_10", panelText1, 5, 190, "Roboto Condensed", 14, clrGold);

string panelText2 = "Max: " + DoubleToString(max_float, 2) + " " + ter_currencySymbol + " (" + DoubleToString(max_float / max_equity * 100, 2) + " %)";

Write("panel_1_11", panelText2, 5, 213, "Roboto Condensed", 11, clrDarkGoldenrod);

} else {

string panelText1 = "DD: -" + DoubleToString(equityDifference, 2) + " " + ter_currencySymbol + " (-100.00 %)";

Write("panel_1_10", panelText1, 5, 190, "Roboto Condensed", 14, clrGold);

string panelText2 = "Max: " + DoubleToString(max_float, 2) + " " + ter_currencySymbol + " (100.00 %)";

Write("panel_1_11", panelText2, 5, 213, "Roboto Condensed", 11, clrDarkGoldenrod);

}

--- 帖子 #2430 ---
I've just fixed another minor error, which was not correctly calculating the ADR for XAU/JPY pairs. I've reuploaded the v2.4 version in my last post.

There are still 6 big features on the wish list I would love to have:

1) manual trading panel to open orders with input field for lot size and arrows which adjust the volume by 0.01 lots (+ all buttons working in the backtester)
2) buy/sell pause buttons to quickly turn on or off the trade direction, which will also smoothly finish all currently open grid cycles
3) hedged partial closing of orders for opposite trades, if there are trades opened in other direction, it will use the profits to close the other grids
4) partial closing by pips which finds the largest loosing position and closes it partially in small parts, if another position goes into profit by XX pips (similar to "AW Recovery EA", "AW Close By Profitables" or "Open Lock EA")
5) multi currency trading especially for global partial closing, which finds the largest loosers and close it using profits from other profitable grids and pairs
6) send settings to custom indicators from an EAs input field line by line, so you don't need to modify the mq4 file, or if you have only the ex4 file

not easy to do, but maybe there is a passionate coder to implement these dreams into our EA?

--- 帖子 #2431 ---

--- 帖子 #2432 ---
Sorry, I can not help everybody to find the buffers for the indicators. You have to put the effort in and find them yourself, study how buffers work. There is already a quick reference guide in the EAs settings. I've also spent lots of time to find out the correct buffers for various indicators.

Attach the indicator to your chart, press CTRL+D and find the buffers. Remember the first buffer has the number 0 and not 1. It starts always from 0. So if there is an arrow at the 4th buffer filled with 1.0000 value on the buy/sell candle signal, then go for the buffer 3 used as an empty indicator, as the value is usually empty and gets only triggered if it gets filled with a value (usually just 1.0000).

--- 帖子 #2435 ---
Yes, this happens also in the backtest, if you are already in deep drawdown, close to margin call, without money... So you should shut down the EA manually or set the account risk to 0.9 for max 90% drawdown, after that it will close all orders, shut down and not send new orders. Try to lower your lot sizes, increase your grid steps, limit your max. orders and/or make sure you have enough money for the entire grid.

Edit: I will set the yoga mode / equity warning to 0.7 (70%) and shut down / account risk to 0.9 (90%) as default for the next version.

ps. working on the "One Candle Limit" function to limit multiple entries on the same candle

Greetings,

Daniel

--- 帖子 #2436 ---
Heyho Gridders,

I'm proud to present you yet another big update of Flexy The Dragon v2.5 with re-ordered risk / recovery settings and a new feature (or actually it's a fix) called "One Candle Limit" which - you guessed it - won't open more grid orders on the same candle anymore, but will wait for the next one. This took a while to code with the help of AI, because I found myself in a loop of repeating errors and complicated fixes by the AI... but after I gave the AI a hint, it finally worked out.

For the next part I want to add another feature "Partial Breaking", which will close the last orders in the grid like a stop loss, if they have reached a specific distance (pips/ATR) in loss and were not beeing able to close in profit by Partial Closing. So it will gradually close the first grid orders to reduce drawdown and get the average TP price closer to the current price to avoid a crash, because sometimes it simply goes down and down or up and up... without retracing enough to trigger the partial closing of the last and first order in the grid.

Greetings,

Daniel

--- 帖子 #2439 ---
Hello gridders,

I was working on the Partial Breaking feature and finally, after the AI drove me complete nuts, finally it worked...  So now you can choose to simply close your oldest/first orders in the grid as soon as X orders in the grid are opened.

You can also combine it with Partial Closing. So if there is a retrace of price, it will try to use the last order to close the first order in profit and if that doesn't work out and the price skyrockets up or stonefalls down then it will close the orders to keep the grid to a certain number of orders.

So here it is: Flexy The Dragon v2.6... Have fun and if you make money consider to by me some coffee... ;D

buymeacoffee.com/danielchan

--- 帖子 #2447 ---
Nicely done!

I need to add, if you're adding this type of feature, you really need to add a automatic Stop Loss to all trades (Even if its 100+ pips away). Should the EA stop/break/crash and the market swings with news, you can literally wipe out an account without a SL.

Maybe a SL above the GRID top & bottom as a safety net would be a very valuable risk management precaution.

--- 帖子 #2448 ---
Hi Gridders,

I have tested the "Partial Breaking" function for 10 years in the backtest on two different H1 pairs and it works as intended. Actually the name "Partial Breaking" is very similar to the "Partial Closing" and might be confusing or easy to mix it up. So I've changed the name to "Grid Outscaling" which describes it quite well.

So let's call it now "Grid Outscaling" instead, which should start to close the 1st/oldest orders in the grid for a loss if it reaches X orders in the grid and keeps closing more orders in the grid until it hits TP.

The other "Partial Closing" uses the last order's profit to close the 1st/oldest order for a small profit and keeps the same lot size of the last order to close the next oldest order until it can hit TP.

Also I've added a little feature to add a custom text on the chart with a strategy name and description, so it's easy to create different strategies and save it as a template. You could for example name one strategy "Bollinger Bands Long" and in the description "trades buy orders with 20 grid step + 10 take profit" or whatever you like. Also you can change the color to "blue" to easy spot the BUY only expert/template.

So here is Flexy The Dragon v2.7 for download below.

So far, keep calm, play safe, get rich.

Greetings, Daniel

Nitty gritty, but got tired of the compile warnings:

changed this:

//old

string nome_file = DoubleToString(versionBMI, 0) + "_" + Symbol() + "_" + IntegerToString(magic) + "_log.txt";

//new

string nome_file = versionBMI + "_" + Symbol() + "_" + IntegerToString(magic) + "_log.txt";

and

//old

string versionStr = DoubleToString(versionBMI, 2);

//new

string versionStr = versionBMI;

and like magic the two compile warning disappears, as versionBMI already is a string.

--- 帖子 #2452 ---
Quick and dirty way to do this would be like this:

Change

string key = "Flexy The Dragon";

into

string key = "";

and the order comment would have stripped the block "Flex The Dragon"

--- 帖子 #2471 ---
Currently about to finish the next version v2.8, which will come with a new built-in ADR indicator with ADR Levels and a Dynamic Percentage to trade those levels on a daily basis for mean reversion or trend strategies.

amrhamdy: That's a good point! I will try to add a separate TP field for the partial closing trades into the settings, as this is also a common input in other EAs, where you can set how many percentage overlap the last position should make, before closing the first position. I think a simple take profit in pips should be fine. Then you can simply put 1 or 2 pips into the field (for the spread) to close the oldest trades for a break even.

Jmge: If you don't have "Yoga Mode" or "Strict Signals" turned to true, it should normally open the next grid order at those lines.

mring16: Yes, of course. Just turn all indicators to false. That's it.  For the next version I will turn off all indicators and leave the ATR dynamic take profit and grid spacing on, for a more classical but still flexible grid trading by default.

quyennh: Do you mean to reduce the TP each time a new candle is formed, so based on time? I'm not sure if this would help much, but feel free to explain your strategy and we might consider it.

Greetings,

Daniel

--- 帖子 #2472 ---
I used Flexy The Dragon v2.7, set the Fixed Grid Step is 0.1 pips, One Candle Limit is True. In my Picture 1, the signal Sell is on 08:45, it means on the next candle 09:00 open the sell order. But on the Candle 09:00, having 2 sell orders open on 09:00 and 09:01. I already set One Candle Limit is True, it means on 09:00 candle open only one sell order. It open 2 sell orders is the bug right? I set the Fixed Grid Step is 0.1 pips because if having any sell signal higher than the last opened sell order, it will open the new sell order, I don't care about the distance between them.

--- 帖子 #2473 ---
Yes, there seems to be an issue during backtesting with opening and closing orders quickly on signals and re-open them. This also happens using the built-in indicators. Currently searching for the bug in the code. It happens randomly and not on the same orders. Doesn't matter if "One Candle Limit" is true/false. Would be interesting to see, if that happened before with previous versions... I'm working on it.

Edit: I've found out that the original "Partial Closing" function will make the trades sometimes open and close immediately and then reopen again during the backtest on all versions, but only if you use less than 3 orders for Partial Closing. So that's not really an issue if you use 3 or more orders for that.

--- 帖子 #2492 ---
Haven't tested it, but try change the function Time_To_Trade into:

Inserted Code bool Time_to_Trade()
{
datetime current_time = TimeCurrent();
int      weekday, hour, minute, second;
weekday = DayOfWeek();
hour = TimeHour(current_time);
minute = TimeMinute(current_time);
second = TimeSeconds(current_time);
if(Restricted_Working_Time)
{
if(weekday * 86400 + hour * 3600 + minute * 60 + second >= StartDay * 86400 + StartHour * 3600 + StartMin * 60 + StartSec
&& weekday * 86400 + hour * 3600 + minute * 60 + second <= StopDay * 86400 + StopHour * 3600 + StopMin * 60 + StopSec)
return(true);
else
return(false);
}
else
{
return(true);
}
}

and be aware that the time restriction of course only handles start of new series meaning count of current buy/sells = 0

--- 帖子 #2511 ---
If you use Icarus 2.2 Post#1 it trades independent of the chart timeframe.

But it works great when the market is NOT trending and if the market is choppy,
for example when the Weekly is not trending and is range bound, you will make some money when you can trader both ways.

However, when the market starts to trend, you will have to "cut-losses short" and "let profits run".  This is the difficult thing for most traders to do ... i.e. knowing when to "cut losses" ...

Example GU Weekly range bound for weeks ...

> this is range bound trading strategy

--- 帖子 #2518 ---
Dear Gridders,

today I've got something really exciting for you with unique features never seen before in an EA...  Flexy The Dragon v2.8 with a bunch of new capabilities, but to make it short and sweet, here is just a brief list:dynamic ATR lot size - v2.8

calculate the lot size based on current market volatility to reduce risk, using the percentage difference of two daily ATRs with a period X and 200, able to adjust the min. and max. lot size + sensitivity of the current ATR in days strict signals for indicators - v2.8

enable "strict signals" for individual custom indicators to separate and control initial and grid orders display all information - v2.8

optimized displaying indicator and all settings information on chart improved profit reducing - v2.8

now the take profit can be reduced per each new grid order by using a percentage instead of pips (minimum TP of 0.01$) advanced partial closing - v2.8

wait until the combined profit of the oldest + current order reaches an amount of positive/negative X pips before closing both orders fixed grid outscaling - v2.8

grid outscaling keept opening orders after closing it (with the last orders lot size) now it will not open endless orders anymore fixed all warnings - v2.8

and added custom comments for orders Please test each function thoroughly and report any major errors you may encounter.

Edit: Haha, that's what happens when you put things out too early. Then you find another mistake there and another one there... lol. So I'll have to look over it again first and then upload version v2.8.1 as soon as I've tested the new dynamic lot size extensively.

Greetings, Daniel

--- 帖子 #2566 ---
Dear Gridders, sorry I didn't continue to work on version v2.8 as I'm working on Little Dragon EA, which is based on VR Smart Grid Lite and is 100x faster and lighter than Flexy. But anyhow. Here is the final version of Flexy The Dragon v2.8 for anyone interested.bi-directional trading - v2.8

add another signal to custom indicator which allows for bi-directional trading in a neutral zone in sideways market condition dynamic ATR lot size - v2.8

calculate the lot size based on current market volatility to reduce risk, using the percentage difference of two daily ATRs with a period X and 200, able to adjust the min. and max. lot size + sensitivity of the current ATR in days strict signals for indicators - v2.8

enable "strict signals" for individual custom indicators to separate and control initial and grid orders display all information - v2.8

optimized displaying indicator and all settings information on chart improved profit reducing - v2.8

now the take profit can be reduced per each new grid order by using a percentage instead of pips (minimum TP of 0.01$) advanced partial closing - v2.8

wait until the combined profit of the oldest + current order reaches an amount of positive/negative X pips before closing both orders fixed grid outscaling - v2.8

grid outscaling keept opening orders after closing it (with the last orders lot size) now it will not open endless orders anymore fixed all warnings - v2.8

and added custom comments for orders I will continue to work on Little Dragon in the future, so this is the last update on Flexy. Good luck and happy trading.

Greetings, Daniel

--- 帖子 #2594 ---
All range bound pairs like EU below.
Run Blessing3 with FMC as your Control and independent of the chart timeframe.
Use the B3 delay setting 2400 which is 4Hr, B3 will place orders every 4hr using or you manually 'inject' market orders to the basket of trades. Keep the number of positions per basket to manageable size and use risk management of the basket to %risk of your account deposit allocated to each pair.
Trade a basket of currencies according to your account size for example start with one pair for every $500. Then add more pairs as your account balance grow. IF you have larger trading capital, you can trade $10,000 for every pair.

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

--- 帖子 #2636 ---
Hi

Can you please check the formula below?

for buy/sell stop

//| Expert initialization function                                   |

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

int OnInit()

{

Print("Enhanced Buy/Sell Stop EA with Support/Resistance initialized successfully.");

return(INIT_SUCCEEDED);

}

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

//| Expert tick function                                             |

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

void OnTick()

{

// Input Parameters

input bool UseDynamicLot = true;           // Use dynamic risk-based lot sizing

input double FixedLotSize = 0.1;           // Fixed lot size (if UseDynamicLot is false)

input double RiskPercentage = 2.0;         // Percentage of account balance to risk

input int StopDistancePips = 20;           // Fixed stop distance in pips

input int TakeProfitPips = 50;             // Fixed take profit in pips

input int ATR_Period = 14;                 // ATR indicator period

input double ATR_Multiplier = 1.5;         // Multiplier for ATR-based stop loss

input bool UseATR = false;                 // Use ATR-based stop loss and take profit

input bool UseBreakEven = true;            // Move stop-loss to break-even

input int BreakEvenPips = 20;              // Profit in pips to trigger break-even

input bool UseTrailingStop = true;         // Enable trailing stop

input int TrailingStopPips = 15;           // Distance for trailing stop in pips

input int MaxOrders = 2;                   // Maximum number of active orders

input int StartHour = 8;                   // Start hour for trading

input int EndHour = 20;                    // End hour for trading

input int TradingDays = 62;                // Binary bitmask for trading days (e.g., 62 for Mon-Fri)

// Calculate support and resistance

double support, resistance;

CalculateSupportResistance(support, resistance);

// Get current market prices

double askPrice = NormalizeDouble(Ask, Digits);

double bidPrice = NormalizeDouble(Bid, Digits);

// Example logic: only place Buy Stop above resistance and Sell Stop below support

double buyStopPrice = resistance + (10 * Point);  // Add a small buffer above resistance

double sellStopPrice = support - (10 * Point);    // Subtract a small buffer below support

// Ensure time and trading day restrictions

int currentHour = TimeHour(TimeCurrent());

int currentDay = TimeDayOfWeek();

if (currentHour < StartHour || currentHour >= EndHour || !(TradingDays & (1 << currentDay)))

{

Print("Outside trading hours or days. No trades placed.");

return;

}

// Get account balance and risk amount

double accountBalance = AccountBalance();

double riskAmount = accountBalance * RiskPercentage / 100.0;

// Calculate ATR if enabled

double atrValue = 0;

if (UseATR)

atrValue = iATR(Symbol(), PERIOD_M5, ATR_Period, 0) * ATR_Multiplier;

// Calculate stop and take profit distances

double stopDistance = UseATR ? atrValue : StopDistancePips * Point;

double takeProfitDistance = UseATR ? atrValue * 2 : TakeProfitPips * Point;

// Calculate lot size

double lotSize;

if (UseDynamicLot)

{

double tickValue = MarketInfo(Symbol(), MODE_TICKVALUE);

lotSize = NormalizeDouble(riskAmount / (stopDistance / Point * tickValue), 2);

lotSize = MathMax(MarketInfo(Symbol(), MODE_MINLOT), MathMin(lotSize, MarketInfo(Symbol(), MODE_MAXLOT)));

}

else

lotSize = FixedLotSize;

// Ensure no more than MaxOrders are active

int totalOrders = OrdersTotal();

if (totalOrders >= MaxOrders)

return;

// Place Buy Stop order

if (!OrderExists(OP_BUYSTOP, buyStopPrice))

{

int buyTicket = OrderSend(Symbol(), OP_BUYSTOP, lotSize, buyStopPrice, 3,

buyStopPrice - stopDistance, buyStopPrice + takeProfitDistance,

"Buy Stop Order", 0, 0, Blue);

if (buyTicket > 0)

Print("Buy Stop order placed at: ", buyStopPrice, " with lot size: ", lotSize);

else

Print("Error placing Buy Stop: ", GetLastError());

}

// Place Sell Stop order

if (!OrderExists(OP_SELLSTOP, sellStopPrice))

{

int sellTicket = OrderSend(Symbol(), OP_SELLSTOP, lotSize, sellStopPrice, 3,

sellStopPrice + stopDistance, sellStopPrice - takeProfitDistance,

"Sell Stop Order", 0, 0, Red);

if (sellTicket > 0)

Print("Sell Stop order placed at: ", sellStopPrice, " with lot size: ", lotSize);

else

Print("Error placing Sell Stop: ", GetLastError());

}

// Apply trailing stop and break-even logic

for (int i = 0; i < OrdersTotal(); i++)

{

if (OrderSelect(i, SELECT_BY_POS, MODE_TRADES) && OrderSymbol() == Symbol())

{

if (UseBreakEven && OrderProfit() >= BreakEvenPips * Point)

{

double newSL = OrderOpenPrice();

if (OrderType() == OP_BUY && OrderStopLoss() < newSL)

OrderModify(OrderTicket(), OrderOpenPrice(), newSL, OrderTakeProfit(), 0, Blue);

if (OrderType() == OP_SELL && OrderStopLoss() > newSL)

OrderModify(OrderTicket(), OrderOpenPrice(), newSL, OrderTakeProfit(), 0, Red);

}

if (UseTrailingStop)

{

double trailingSL;

if (OrderType() == OP_BUY)

trailingSL = Bid - TrailingStopPips * Point;

else if (OrderType() == OP_SELL)

trailingSL = Ask + TrailingStopPips * Point;

if ((OrderType() == OP_BUY && trailingSL > OrderStopLoss()) ||

(OrderType() == OP_SELL && trailingSL < OrderStopLoss()))

OrderModify(OrderTicket(), OrderOpenPrice(), trailingSL, OrderTakeProfit(), 0, Yellow);

}

}

}

}

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

//| Helper function to check if order exists at a specific price     |

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

bool OrderExists(int orderType, double price)

{

for (int i = 0; i < OrdersTotal(); i++)

{

if (OrderSelect(i, SELECT_BY_POS, MODE_TRADES))

{

if (OrderSymbol() == Symbol() && OrderType() == orderType && NormalizeDouble(OrderOpenPrice(), Digits) == NormalizeDouble(price, Digits))

return true;

}

}

return false;

}

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

//| Function to calculate support and resistance levels              |

//+------------------------------------------------------------------+

void CalculateSupportResistance(double &support, double &resistance)

{

double high = -DBL_MAX;   // Initialize high to minimum value

double low = DBL_MAX;     // Initialize low to maximum value

// Loop through the lookback period to find the high and low

for (int i = 0; i < LookbackPeriod; i++)

{

double barHigh = iHigh(Symbol(), Timeframe, i);

double barLow = iLow(Symbol(), Timeframe, i);

if (barHigh > high)

high = barHigh;

if (barLow < low)

low = barLow;

}

// Calculate ATR for adjustment if enabled

double atr = 0;

if (UseATRAdjustment)

atr = iATR(Symbol(), Timeframe, 14, 0) * ATR_Multiplier;

else

atr = 0;

// Set support and resistance levels

resistance = high + atr;   // Adjusted resistance level

support = low - atr;       // Adjusted support level

}

this formul have some error, and i cant resolve it

thank you

--- 帖子 #2657 ---

--- 帖子 #2658 ---
How do you decide when to move?

--- 帖子 #2659 ---
Its individual.  You could do percent gain on equity; you could do double the equity.

If I put 200 bucks in account that's my stop (Depending on the grid since some have an option to stop trading at X Draw down Percent)

So, in this case 200 becomes 400 I move 200 into trading the wallet (not all brokers have this) or move it to a dormant account.  (or to a safer trading account)

The idea is to take profit money and build another account.  Grids blow up, that's just the nature, but they can make an impressive amount of money.

Let's be honest any EA that makes money should have some withdrawals to build more accounts to make more money with dame EA in same broker or another.

If you have a very large account and used conservative settings, you could in theory take out money but there will always be floating DD (with most grids)

In theory let's say 10k account grows to 11k in a few days you remove the 1k every time to build another account.  Or move it to a safer trading account. OR just save it in dormant account until you have another 10k to do it again buttttt.....

Better to have different brokers for each grid because once you start pulling out more than 1k every few days into your bank account to live on they have a tendency to close your accounts.  (not all but many)

There is no hard rule 80808 just take advantage of the power of grid trading.  At the end they will always blow, but currency selection, gap size, multiplier size, etc will determine how safe and how reliable you can double the equity or maybe even pull out 20% equity until it crashes.

I'm still backtesting 2.8 and so far not looking good for me in TW broker.

--- 帖子 #2678 ---
I like to trend trade mostly

--- 帖子 #2679 ---
I find you should not leave money in a grid system you want to keep because it will blow up.

But I find they print money.  I'm very unconventional and a $200 SL doesn't bother me.  So, I'll put $200 in a grid and every time it hits $400, I take $200 out.  Basically, to quote gamers I'm farming for other accounts.   You could also say I have several "feeder" accounts where the profits made go into the safer accounts.  I like the gamer one better LOL

Eventually the account blows up.  Certain months price just runs and you can't do much about that.  EG seems to move sideways the most.  It's not for everyone I suppose.

Be advised I now fund $500 dollar grids.

--- 帖子 #2680 ---
----

I mean people thinking $500 usd is enough and wont get smoked in a trillion dollar markets are beyond my understanding but glad it works for you.

Theres this simple trick by using cent accounts... I havent blowed and account since 2021 using grid, multipliers, NO stop loss (is for newbies and people that cant trust their own strategies) and counter trending 100% of the time by using hedge triggers.

I guess is a matter of each trader skill set and market understanding.

If someone asks me, based in my real results, I can safely say you can leave money in grid systems anytime.

Sadly people throw a lot at grid system but they cant make SL work either so I just roll with what my eyes can see.

Not spending much time with others since I now understand the skill gap is what creates conflicts while discussing strategies and execution.
